1. [tei] Declarations for classes, datatypes, and macros available to all TEI modules

1.1. Attribute classes

att.ascribed
provides attributes for elements representing speech or action that can be ascribed to a specific individual.提供的元素屬性代表言詞或行為，可出自某一特定個人。
 
 @who
indicates the person, or group of people, to whom the element content is ascribed.指出該元素內容所歸屬的個人或團體。
att.damaged
provides attributes describing the nature of any physical damage affecting a reading. No zh-tw for "provides attributes describing the nature of any physical damage affecting a reading. "
 
 @extent
indicates approximately how much text is in the damaged area, in letters, minims, inches, or any appropriate unit, where this cannot be deduced from the contents of the tag. No zh-tw for "indicates approximately how much text is in the damaged area, in letters, minims, inches, or any appropriate unit, where this cannot be deduced from the contents of the tag. "
 @hand
In the case of damage (deliberate defacement, inking out, etc.) assignable to a distinct hand, signifies the hand responsible for the damage.No zh-tw for "In the case of damage (deliberate defacement, inking out, etc.) assignable to a distinct hand, signifies the hand responsible for the damage."
 @agent
categorizes the cause of the damage, if it can be identified.No zh-tw for "categorizes the cause of the damage, if it can be identified."
 
  rubbing
damage results from rubbing of the leaf edgesNo zh-tw for "damage results from rubbing of the leaf edges"
  mildew
damage results from mildew on the leaf surfaceNo zh-tw for "damage results from mildew on the leaf surface"
  smoke
damage results from smokeNo zh-tw for "damage results from smoke"
 @degree
Signifies the degree of damage according to a convenient scale. The damage tag with the degree attribute should only be used where the text may be read with some confidence; text supplied from other sources should be tagged as supplied.No zh-tw for "Signifies the degree of damage according to a convenient scale. The damage tag with the degree attribute should only be used where the text may be read with some confidence; text supplied from other sources should be tagged as supplied."
 @group
assigns an arbitrary number to each stretch of damage regarded as forming part of the same physical phenomenon.No zh-tw for "assigns an arbitrary number to each stretch of damage regarded as forming part of the same physical phenomenon."
att.datable
provides attributes for normalization of elements that contain dates, times, or datable events.提供用於元素規格化的屬性，這些元素包含日期明確的事件。
att.datable.w3c
provides attributes for normalization of elements that contain datable events using the W3C datatypes.提供用於元素規格化的屬性，這些元素包含以W3C datatypes所定義的日期明確之事件。
 
 @period
supplies a pointer to some location defining a named period of time within which the datable item is understood to have occurred.No zh-tw for "supplies a pointer to some location defining a named period of time within which the datable item is understood to have occurred."
 @when
supplies the value of a date or time in a standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.No zh-tw for "supplies the value of a date or time in a standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd."
 @notBefore
specifies the earliest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.以標準格式說明該事件可能發生的最早日期，例如年-月-日。
 @notAfter
specifies the latest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.以標準形式標明該事件可能的最晚日期，例如年-月-日。
 @from
indicates the starting point of the period in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.以標準格式表示該段時間的起始點。
 @to
indicates the ending point of the period in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.以標準格式表示該段時間的結束點。
att.declarable
provides attributes for those elements in the TEI Header which may be independently selected by means of the special purpose decls attribute.提供屬性，用於TEI標頭內可單獨以特殊目的的屬性decls選出的元素。
 
 @default
indicates whether or not this element is selected by default when its parent is selected.當父元素被選擇時，指出此元素是否會被選擇。
 
  true
This element is selected if its parent is selected若父元素被選擇，則此元素會被選擇。
  false
This element can only be selected explicitly, unless it is the only one of its kind, in which case it is selected if its parent is selected.此元素僅能被明確選擇，若此元素為其類別中之唯一，則父元素被選擇時，此元素會被選擇。
att.declaring
provides attributes for elements which may be independently associated with a particular declarable element within the header, thus overriding the inherited default for that element.提供元素屬性，這些元素可單獨與標頭中一特定可宣告元素相關連，因此超越該特定元素本身的預設值。
 
 @decls
identifies one or more declarable elements within the header, which are understood to apply to the element bearing this attribute and its content.指明標頭內一個或多個可宣告元素，可應用於帶有此屬性與內容的元素上。
att.dimensions
provides attributes for describing the size of physical objects.提供符合某種度量值的屬性值。
 
 @unit
names the unit used for the measurement度量單位的名稱。
 
  cm
centimetresNo zh-tw for "centimetres"
  mm
millimetresNo zh-tw for "millimetres"
  in
inchesNo zh-tw for "inches"
  lines
lines of textNo zh-tw for "lines of text"
  chars
charactersNo zh-tw for "characters"
characters of textNo zh-tw for "characters of text"
 @quantity
specifies the length in the units specifiedNo zh-tw for "specifies the length in the units specified"
 @scope
specifies the applicability of this measurement, where more than one object is being measured.測量多個物件時，標明此度量的可應用範圍。
 
  all
measurement applies to all instances.度量可應用於所有實例。
  most
measurement applies to most of the instances inspected.度量可應用於大部分實例。
  range
measurement applies to only the specified range of instances.度量僅應用於特定範圍的實例。
att.divLike
provides attributes common to all elements which behave in the same way as divisions.提供一組屬性，通用於所有與區段作用相 同的元素。
 
 @org
organizationNo zh-tw for "organization"
specifies how the content of the division is organized.說明該區段內容的組合方式。
 
  composite
composite content: i.e. no claim is made about the sequence in which the immediate contents of this division are to be processed, or their inter-relationships.複合內容：未說明此區段目前內容的處理順序或相互關係。
  uniform
uniform content: i.e. the immediate contents of this element are regarded as forming a logical unit, to be processed in sequence.一致內容：此區段目前的內容形成一個邏輯單位，且會依序處理。
 @sample
indicates whether this division is a sample of the original source and if so, from which part.指出此區段是否為來源文件的樣本，若為樣本，則說明出自哪一部分。
 
  initial
division lacks material present at end in source.區段的末端無資料
  medial
division lacks material at start and end.區段的起始與末端無資料
  final
division lacks material at start.區段的起始部分無資料
  unknown
position of sampled material within original unknown.來源文件中的樣本資料位置不明
  complete
division is not a sample.區段非樣本
 @part
specifies whether or not the division is fragmented by some other structural element, for example a speech which is divided between two or more verse stanzas.說明該區段是否被其他結構性元素切割，例如一段話語被兩個或多個詩節分開。
 
  Y
yesNo zh-tw for "yes"
the division is incomplete in some respect該區段某些方面不完整
  N
noNo zh-tw for "no"
either the division is complete, or no claim is made as to its completeness.該區段完整，或者未說明其完整性。
  I
initialNo zh-tw for "initial"
the initial part of an incomplete division不完整區段的起始部分
  M
medialNo zh-tw for "medial"
a medial part of an incomplete division不完整區段的中段部分
  F
finalNo zh-tw for "final"
the final part of an incomplete division不完整區段的末端部分
att.duration.w3c
attributes for recording normalized temporal durations.用於記錄時間長度規格化的屬性
 
 @dur
duration時間長度
indicates the length of this element in time.指明此元素的時間長度。
att.editLike
provides attributes describing the nature of a encoded scholarly intervention or interpretation of any kind.提供屬性，描述任何已標記的學者更正或詮釋的性質。
 
 @cert
certaintyNo zh-tw for "certainty"
signifies the degree of certainty associated with the intervention or interpretation.表示該更動或詮釋的相關正確度。
 @resp
responsible partyNo zh-tw for "responsible party"
indicates the agency responsible for the intervention or interpretation, for example an editor or transcriber.指出負責該更動或詮釋的代理者，例如編輯或轉錄者。
 @evidence
indicates the nature of the evidence supporting the reliability or accuracy of the intervention or interpretation.指出支持該更動或詮釋可信度或正確性的證明
 
  internal
there is internal evidence to support the intervention.有內部證明得以支持
  external
there is external evidence to support the intervention.有外部證明得以支持
  conjecture
the intervention or interpretation has been made by the editor, cataloguer, or scholar on the basis of their expertise.編輯、編目者或學者根據自身的專業來執行該更動或詮釋。
 @source
contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the sources which support the given reading.No zh-tw for "contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the sources which support the given reading."
att.global
provides attributes common to all elements in the TEI encoding scheme.提供一組屬性，通用於TEI編碼標準中的所有元素。
 
 @xml:id
identifierNo zh-tw for "identifier"
provides a unique identifier for the element bearing the attribute.提供一個獨特識別符碼，識別帶有該屬性的元素。
 @n
numberNo zh-tw for "number"
gives a number (or other label) for an element, which is not necessarily unique within the document.將元素標上一個數字 (或其他標號)，該標號在文件中未必是獨特的。
 @xml:lang
languageNo zh-tw for "language"
indicates the language of the element content using a tag generated according to BCP 47使用RFC3066的代碼，指出該元素內容的使用語言
 @rend
renditionNo zh-tw for "rendition"
indicates how the element in question was rendered or presented in the source text.指出該元素如何呈現於來源文件中
 @rendition
points to a description of the rendering or presentation used for this element in the source text.No zh-tw for "points to a description of the rendering or presentation used for this element in the source text."
 @xml:base
provides a base URI reference with which applications can resolve relative URI references into absolute URI references.提供一個基礎統一資源識別符 (URI) 參照，可將相對統一資源識別符參照轉變為絕對統一資源識別符參照。

att.timed

  true

  false
This element can only be selected explicitly, unless it is the only one of its kind, in which case it is selected if its parent is selected.此元素僅能被明確選擇，若此元素為其類別中之唯一，則父元素被選擇時，此元素會被選擇。

 @spanTo

 @end

 @status

  duplicate
all of the text indicated as an addition duplicates some text that is in the original, whether the duplication is word-for-word or less exact.No zh-tw for "all of the text indicated as an addition duplicates some text that is in the original, whether the duplication is word-for-word or less exact."
  duplicate-partial

  excessStart

  excessEnd

  shortStart

  shortEnd

  partial

  unremarkable

2. [header] The TEI Header

2.1. Elements

appInfo
application informationNo zh-tw for "application information"
records information about an application which has edited the TEI file. No zh-tw for "records information about an application which has edited the TEI file. "
application
provides information about an application which has acted upon the document.No zh-tw for "provides information about an application which has acted upon the document."
 
 @ident
Supplies an identifier for the application, independent of its version number or display name.No zh-tw for "Supplies an identifier for the application, independent of its version number or display name."
 @version
Supplies a version number for the application, independent of its identifier or display name.No zh-tw for "Supplies a version number for the application, independent of its identifier or display name."
authority
release authority供應機構
supplies the name of a person or other agency responsible for making an electronic file available, other than a publisher or distributor.說明除了出版者或發行者之外，負責提供電子檔案的個人或其他經銷商的名稱。
availability
supplies information about the availability of a text, for example any restrictions on its use or distribution, its copyright status, etc.提供關於文件可利用性的資訊，例如使用或發行上的任何限制、版權狀態等。
 
 @status
supplies a code identifying the current availability of the text. 提供一個代號，用來確認文件目前的可利用性。
 
  free
the text is freely available. 文件的可利用性不受限。
  unknown
the status of the text is unknown. 文件狀態不明。
  restricted
the text is not freely available. 文件的可利用性受限制。
biblFull
fully-structured bibliographic citation
contains a fully-structured bibliographic citation, in which all components of the TEI file description are present.包含結構完整的書目資料，其中呈現出TEI檔案描述內的所有元件。
cRefPattern
canonical reference pattern定義如何將標準參照轉換成統一資源識別符 (URI) 。
specifies an expression and replacement pattern for transforming a canonical reference into a URI. 標明將標準參照轉換成統一資源識別符的表示方法與取代模式。
 
 @matchPattern
specifies a regular expression against which the values of cRef attributes can be matched.標明一個表示屬性cRef屬性值的固定方法。
 @replacementPattern
specifies a replacement pattern which, once subpattern substitution has been performed, provides a URI.標明一個取代模式，一旦進行次要模式的替換，會自動提供統一資源識別符 (URI) 。
catDesc
category description類目描述
describes some category within a taxonomy or text typology, either in the form of a brief prose description or in terms of the situational parameters used by the TEI formal textDesc.描述分類法中或文件類型學中的某些類目，可用短文描述的型式，或是用TEI正式元素textDesc所使用的狀況參數。
catRef
category reference類目參照
specifies one or more defined categories within some taxonomy or text typology.標明在某分類法或文件類型學中，一個或多個已定義之類目。
 
 @target
identifies the categories concerned 標明相關的類目。
 @scheme
identifies the classification scheme within which the set of categories concerned is defined 標明該分類架構，其中相關的類目群組已被定義

change
summarizes a particular change or correction made to a particular version of an electronic text which is shared between several researchers.概述多位研究者共享的某版本電子文本當中，某特定的內容變更或修正。
 
 @when

 @scheme

classDecl
classification declarations分類宣告
contains one or more taxonomies defining any classificatory codes used elsewhere in the text.包含一個或多個分類法，用來定義在文件中他處所使用之任何分類碼。
correction
correction principles更正原則
states how and under what circumstances corrections have been made in the text.說明文本中的更正是在什麼情況下、如何產生的。
 
 @status
indicates the degree of correction applied to the text. 指出文本更正的程度。
 
  high
the text has been thoroughly checked and proofread. 該文本以被徹底檢查校對過。
  medium
the text has been checked at least once. 該文本被檢查過至少一次。
  low
the text has not been checked. 該文本從未被檢查過。
  unknown
the correction status of the text is unknown. 更正狀態不明
 @method
indicates the method adopted to indicate corrections within the text. 說明標示更正所採取的方法。
 
  silent

  markup

creation
contains information about the creation of a text.包含關於文件建置的資訊。
distributor

fileDesc

hyphenation

 @eol
end-of-lineNo zh-tw for "end-of-line"
indicates whether or not end-of-line hyphenation has been retained in a text.指出行末連字符號是否在文本中被保留。
 
  all
all end-of-line hyphenation has been retained, even though the lineation of the original may not have been. 保留所有行末連字符號，即使原文中的不被保留。
  some
end-of-line hyphenation has been retained in some cases. 行末連字符號在某些情況下被保留。
  hard
all soft end-of-line hyphenation has been removed: any remaining end-od-line hyphenation should be retained. 所有軟音的行末連字符號皆被移除：任何剩下的行末連字符號應該被保留。
  none
all end-of-line hyphenation has been removed: any remaining hyphenation occurred within the line. 所有行末連字符號皆被移除：剩下的是行中出現的行末連字符號。

 @ident

 @method

  markup

quotation

 @marks
quotation marksNo zh-tw for "quotation marks"
indicates whether or not quotation marks have been retained as content within the text. 指出引文符號是否在文本中被保留為內容的一部份。
 
  none
no quotation marks have been retained 不保留任何引文符號
  some
some quotation marks have been retained 保留部分引文符號
  all
all quotation marks have been retained 保留所有引文符號
 @form
specifies how quotation marks are indicated within the text.說明引文符號如何標示於文本中。
refState
reference state分界狀態
specifies one component of a canonical reference defined by the milestone method.標明分界方法所定義的權威參照標準裡其中一個組件。
 
 @ed
editionNo zh-tw for "edition"
indicates which edition or version the milestone applies to.No zh-tw for "indicates which edition or version the milestone applies to."
 @unit
indicates what kind of state is changing at this milestone.No zh-tw for "indicates what kind of state is changing at this milestone."
 
  page
page breaks in the reference edition. No zh-tw for "page breaks in the reference edition. "
  column
column breaks. No zh-tw for "column breaks. "
  line
line breaks. No zh-tw for "line breaks. "
  book
any units termed book, liber, etc. No zh-tw for "any units termed book, liber, etc. "
  poem
individual poems in a collection. No zh-tw for "individual poems in a collection. "
  canto
cantos or other major sections of a poem. No zh-tw for "cantos or other major sections of a poem. "
  stanza
stanzas within a poem, book, or canto. No zh-tw for "stanzas within a poem, book, or canto. "
  act
acts within a play. No zh-tw for "acts within a play. "
  scene
scenes within a play or act. No zh-tw for "scenes within a play or act. "
  section
sections of any kind. No zh-tw for "sections of any kind. "
  absent
passages not present in the reference edition.No zh-tw for "passages not present in the reference edition."
 @length
specifies the fixed length of the reference component.No zh-tw for "specifies the fixed length of the reference component."
 @delim
delimiterNo zh-tw for "delimiter"
supplies a delimiting string following the reference component.No zh-tw for "supplies a delimiting string following the reference component."
refsDecl
references declaration參照宣告
specifies how canonical references are constructed for this text.標明本文件與某一個權威參照標準的關係。
rendition
supplies information about the rendition or appearance of one or more elements in the source text.提供關於一個或多個元素預定呈現方式的資訊。
 
 @scheme
identifies the language used to describe the rendition.No zh-tw for "identifies the language used to describe the rendition."
 
  css
Cascading Stylesheet LanguageNo zh-tw for "Cascading Stylesheet Language"
  xslfo
Extensible Stylesheet Language Formatting ObjectsNo zh-tw for "Extensible Stylesheet Language Formatting Objects"
  free
Informal free text descriptionNo zh-tw for "Informal free text description"
  other
A user-defined rendition description languageNo zh-tw for "A user-defined rendition description language"
revisionDesc
revision description修訂描述
summarizes the revision history for a file.概述檔案的修訂歷史。
samplingDecl
sampling declaration取樣宣告
contains a prose description of the rationale and methods used in sampling texts in the creation of a corpus or collection.以篇章描述的方式說明建立文集或文選時文件取樣的原理與方法。
segmentation
describes the principles according to which the text has been segmented, for example into sentences, tone-units, graphemic strata, etc.描述文件分割的原理方法，例如分割成句子、音調單位、字形層次等。
seriesStmt
series statement集叢陳述
groups information about the series, if any, to which a publication belongs.若出版品隸屬於某叢書，則在此匯集該叢書的相關資訊。
sourceDesc
source description
supplies a description of the source text(s) from which an electronic text was derived or generated.提供所製電子文件的一個或數個來源文件的書目描述。
sponsor
specifies the name of a sponsoring organization or institution.標明贊助的組織或機構名稱。
stdVals
standard values標準值
specifies the format used when standardized date or number values are supplied.明確說明文本中標準化日期或數值所使用的格式。
tagUsage
supplies information about the usage of a specific element within a text. 提供文件中某個特定元素的使用資訊。
 
 @gi
element nameNo zh-tw for "element name"
the name (generic identifier) of the element indicated by the tag.該標籤所指明的元素名稱 (通用識別符碼)。
 @occurs
specifies the number of occurrences of this element within the text.指出該元素在文本中出現的次數。
 @withId
with unique identifierNo zh-tw for "with unique identifier"
specifies the number of occurrences of this element within the text which bear a distinct value for the global xml:id attribute. 指出帶有明確全域屬性xml:id屬性值的元素在文本中的出現次數。
 @render
specifies the identifier of a rendition element which defines how this element is to be rendered.標明元素rendition的識別符號，該符號定義此元素的呈現方法。
tagsDecl
tagging declaration標誌宣告
provides detailed information about the tagging applied to a document.提供關於應用在XML文件中的標誌的詳細資訊。
taxonomy
defines a typology used to classify texts either implicitly, by means of a bibliographic citation, or explicitly by a structured taxonomy.定義文件分類的類型學，可以是潛在地以書目資料的方式，或是明確地以結構分類法的方式來分類。
teiHeader
TEI HeaderTEI標頭
supplies the descriptive and declarative information making up an electronic title page prefixed to every TEI-conformant text.在所有符合TEI標準的文本起始的電子題名頁當中提供敘述性以及宣告性的資訊。
 
 @type
specifies the kind of document to which the header is attached, for example whether it is a corpus or individual text.標明標頭所附屬於的文件類型，例如文集或單一文本。
 
  text
the header is attached to a single text.標頭附屬於單一文本中。
  corpus
the header is attached to a corpus.標頭附屬於文集中。
textClass
text classification文件分類
groups information which describes the nature or topic of a text in terms of a standard classification scheme, thesaurus, etc.匯集以標準分類架構、索引典等來描述文件性質或主題的資訊。
titleStmt
title statement題名陳述
groups information about the title of a work and those responsible for its intellectual content.匯集關於作品標題與作品智慧內容責任歸屬的資訊。

3. [core] Elements common to all TEI documents

3.1. Elements

abbr
abbreviation縮寫
contains an abbreviation of any sort.包含任何形式的縮寫。
 
 @type
allows the encoder to classify the abbreviation according to some convenient typology.標記者可以用合宜的分類方法將縮寫形式分類。
 
  suspension
the abbreviation provides the first letter(s) of the word or phrase, omitting the remainder.僅提供字詞開端的一個或一個以上的字母，並省略其他部分的縮寫形式。
  contraction
the abbreviation omits some letter(s) in the middle.省略單字當中某些字母的縮寫形式。
  brevigraph
the abbreviation comprises a special symbol or mark.包含特殊符號或標記的縮寫形式。
  superscription
the abbreviation includes writing above the line.包含上標文字的縮寫形式。
  acronym
the abbreviation comprises the initial letters of the words of a phrase.僅包含一詞組當中字首字母的縮寫形式。
  title
the abbreviation is for a title of address (Dr, Ms, Mr, …)用於頭銜稱呼的縮寫 (Dr, Ms, Mr, …)。
  organization
the abbreviation is for the name of an organization.用於機構團體名稱的縮寫。
  geographic
the abbreviation is for a geographic name.用於地理名稱的縮寫。
add
addition插入
contains letters, words, or phrases inserted in the text by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector.包含由作者、抄寫者、註解者、或更正者在文本中插入的字母、單字或詞彙。
addrLine
address line
contains one line of a postal address.包含郵寄地址或其他地址其的一行。
address
contains a postal address, for example of a publisher, an organization, or an individual.包含出版者、機構、或是個人的郵寄地址或其他地址。
analytic
analytic level分析層書目
contains bibliographic elements describing an item (e.g. an article or poem) published within a monograph or journal and not as an independent publication.包含某一項目 (例如詩或文章) 的書目元素，該項目並非獨立出版品，而是刊登在專題著作或是期刊當中。
author
in a bibliographic reference, contains the name of the author(s), personal or corporate, of a work; the primary statement of responsibility for any bibliographic item. 在書目參照中，包含一件作品的作者 (群) 姓名，無論是個人或是團體性質；這也是書目項目責任歸屬的主要陳述。
bibl
bibliographic citation書目資料
contains a loosely-structured bibliographic citation of which the sub-components may or may not be explicitly tagged. 包含結構零散的書目資料，其中次要元件不一定會明確標記。
biblScope
scope of citation書目引用範圍
defines the scope of a bibliographic reference, for example as a list of page numbers, or a named subdivision of a larger work.標明書目參照資訊的範圍，例如標示頁碼列表、或是某著作的分支作品名稱。
 
 @type
identifies the type of information conveyed by the element, e.g. pages, volume.標明該元素所表達的資訊類型，例如頁、 冊。
 
  vol
volumeNo zh-tw for "volume"
the element contains a volume number.該元素標記的內容為冊號。
  issue
the element contains an issue number, or volume and issue numbers.該元素標記的內容為一期刊號或冊號與期刊號。
  pp
pagesNo zh-tw for "pages"
the element contains a page number or page range.該元素標記的內容為一頁數或頁數範圍。
  chap
chapterNo zh-tw for "chapter"
the element contains a chapter indication (number and/or title)No zh-tw for "the element contains a chapter indication (number and/or title)"
  part
the element identifies a part of a book or collection.該元素標明的內容為單書或集合作品的一部份。
biblStruct
structured bibliographic citation結構次要書目
contains a structured bibliographic citation, in which only bibliographic sub-elements appear and in a specified order. 包含僅出現子節點的結構書目資料，並以特定順序呈現。
binaryObject
provides encoded binary data representing an inline graphic or other object.標記用來表示文本中圖檔或其他檔案的二進位資料。
 
 @width
The display width of the object檔案顯示的寬度
 @height
The display height of the object檔案顯示的高度
 @scale
A scale factor to be applied to the object to make it the desired display size用來調整檔案顯示大小的比例係數
 @encoding
The encoding used to encode the binary data. If not specified, this is assumed to be Base64.標記該二進位資料時所使用到的編碼。若未特別指明，則假定為使用Base64編碼
cb
column break分段
marks the boundary between one column of a text and the next in a standard reference system.用標準參照系統來標明文本段落之間的分界。
 
 @ed
editionNo zh-tw for "edition"
indicates the edition or version in which the column break is located at this point指出該分段位於哪一版本
choice
groups a number of alternative encodings for the same point in a text.匯集文件中對於同一部分文字所有可供替換的不同標記。
cit
cited quotation
contains a quotation from some other document, together with a bibliographic reference to its source. In a dictionary it may contain an example text with at least one occurrence of the word form, used in the sense being described, or a translation of the headword, or an example. 從其他文件中引用的內容，並包含引用來源的書目參照資料。
corr
correction更正
contains the correct form of a passage apparently erroneous in the copy text.包含文本中看似錯誤並加以更正過後的文字。
date
contains a date in any format.包含任何格式的日期表示。
 
 @calendar
indicates the system or calendar to which the date belongs.指明該日期表示所使用的曆法計算系統。
 
  Gregorian
Gregorian calendar格里高里曆
  Julian
Julian calendar凱撒曆
  Islamic
Islamic or Muslim (hijri) lunar calendar伊斯蘭或穆斯林 (哈吉來) 陽曆
  Hebrew
Hebrew or Jewish lunisolar calendar希伯來或猶太陰陽曆
  Revolutionary
French Revolutionary calendar法國共和曆
  Iranian
Iranian or Persian (Jalaali) solar calendar伊朗或波斯 (Jalaali) 陽曆
  Coptic
Coptic or Alexandrian calendar埃及古曆或亞歷山大曆
  Chinese
Chinese lunisolar calendar中國陰陽曆
del
deletion刪除
contains a letter, word, or passage deleted, marked as deleted, or otherwise indicated as superfluous or spurious in the copy text by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector.標記在文本中，由作者、抄寫者、註解者、或更正者刪除、標上刪除記號、或者標明為多餘或偽造的字母或單字。
desc
description描述
contains a brief description of the intended usage, purpose, or application of its parent element.包含一段簡短描述，說明一元素、屬性、或屬性值的應用與目的。
distinct
identifies any word or phrase which is regarded as linguistically distinct, for example as archaic, technical, dialectal, non-preferred, etc., or as forming part of a sublanguage. 標明被視為特殊用語的字詞，例如：古語、專業用語、方言、非推薦用語等，或標明形成部分次要語言的字詞
 
 @type
specifies the sublanguage or register to which the word or phrase is being assigned指明所標記的字詞屬於哪一種次要語言或語體層次
 @time
specifies how the phrase is distinct diachronically指明該字詞是屬於哪一種時間上的特殊用語
 @space
specifies how the phrase is distinct diatopically指明該字詞是屬於哪一種區域上的特殊用語
 @social
specifies how the phrase is distinct diastatically指明該字詞是屬於哪一種社會層次分類上的特殊用語
divGen
automatically generated text division自動產生的文字區段
indicates the location at which a textual division generated automatically by a text-processing application is to appear.指出文件處理軟體運作下自動產生的文字區段所出現的位置。
 
 @type
specifies what type of generated text division (e.g. index, table of contents, etc.) is to appear.具體指明何種文字區段 (如索引、目錄等) 會出現。
 
  index
an index is to be generated and inserted at this point.索引會產生並置入於此處
  toc
table of contentsNo zh-tw for "table of contents"
a table of contents目錄
  figlist
figure listNo zh-tw for "figure list"
a list of figures圖表列表
  tablist
table listNo zh-tw for "table list"
a list of tables表格列表
editor
secondary statement of responsibility for a bibliographic item, for example the name of an individual, institution or organization, (or of several such) acting as editor, compiler, translator, etc. 書目項目的次要責任歸屬，例如扮演編輯、編譯、翻譯等角色的個人、機構或組織 (或其他類似者) 的名稱。
 
 @role
specifies the nature of the intellectual responsibility具體說明智慧責任的性質
email
electronic mail address
contains an e-mail address identifying a location to which e-mail messages can be delivered. 包含一個電子郵件位址，標明電子郵件訊息可傳送的位置。
emph
emphasized強調
marks words or phrases which are stressed or emphasized for linguistic or rhetorical effect.為了語言上或修辭上的效果而加重語氣或特別強調的字句。
expan
expansion縮寫還原
contains the expansion of an abbreviation.包含一個縮寫詞的還原形式。
foreign
foreign外文
identifies a word or phrase as belonging to some language other than that of the surrounding text. 標明所屬語言不同於週遭文字的字詞。
gap
indicates a point where material has been omitted in a transcription, whether for editorial reasons described in the TEI header, as part of sampling practice, or because the material is illegible, invisible, or inaudible.指出轉錄時被省略部分的位置，省略也許是出於 TEI標頭裡描述的編輯上的理由、也許是因為抽樣轉錄而省略、或是因為資料不明難以辨認或聽懂。
 
 @reason
gives the reason for omission. Sample values include sampling, illegible, inaudible, irrelevant, cancelled, illegible.說明省略的原因。屬性值的例子有sampling、illegible、inaudible、irrelevant、cancelled、cancelled and illegible。
 @hand
in the case of text omitted from the transcription because of deliberate deletion by an identifiable hand, signifies the hand which made the deletion.若省略的內容是被身分明確的抄寫員由轉錄當中刻意刪除，則在此表明抄寫員的身分。
 @agent
In the case of text omitted because of damage, categorizes the cause of the damage, if it can be identified.若省略是由於內容遭受損毀，且可識別損毀原因，則針對損毀原因加以分類。
 
  rubbing
damage results from rubbing of the leaf edges損毀起因於書頁邊緣摩擦受損
  mildew
damage results from mildew on the leaf surface損毀起因於書頁表面發霉
  smoke
damage results from smoke損毀起因於煙燻
 @extent
indicates approximately how much text has been omitted from the transcription (using the unit specified on the unit attribute), either because of editorial policy or because a deletion, damage, or other cause has rendered transcription impossible.約略指出在轉錄當中省略的文字量，可用字母數、公釐、英吋、或其他適當的單位來表示。省略可能是出於編輯策略、來源文本中的刪除、損毀、或其他因素而導致無法轉錄。
 @unit
names the unit used for describing the extent of the gapNo zh-tw for "names the unit used for describing the extent of the gap"
 
  lines
lines of textNo zh-tw for "lines of text"
  chars
charactersNo zh-tw for "characters"
characters of textNo zh-tw for "characters of text"
  pages
pages, i.e. one side of a leafNo zh-tw for "pages, i.e. one side of a leaf"
  cm
centimetresNo zh-tw for "centimetres"
  mm
millimetresNo zh-tw for "millimetres"
  in
inchesNo zh-tw for "inches"
gloss
identifies a phrase or word used to provide a gloss or definition for some other word or phrase.標明用來為另一個字詞下定義或提供註解的字詞。
 
 @target
identifies the associated term element by an absolute or relative URI reference用一個絕對或相對的統一資源識別符參照來標明相關聯的元素term
 @cRef
canonical referenceNo zh-tw for "canonical reference"
identifies the associated term element using a canonical reference from a scheme defined in a refsDecl element in the TEI header用元素refsDecl在TEI標頭內所定義的標準參照來指明相關聯的元素term
graphic
indicates the location of an inline graphic, illustration, or figure.指出文字文件中內含的圖形、插圖、或圖表的位置。
 
 @width
The display width of the image圖片顯示的寬度
 @height
The display height of the image圖片顯示的高度
 @scale
A scale factor to be applied to the image to make it the desired display size用來調整圖片顯示大小的比例係數
 @url
uniform resource locatorNo zh-tw for "uniform resource locator"
A URL which refers to the image itself.目標統一資源識別符
head
heading標題
contains any type of heading, for example the title of a section, or the heading of a list, glossary, manuscript description, etc.包含任何種類的標題，如章節、列表、詞彙表、寫本描述等的標題。
headItem
heading for list items列表項目的標題
contains the heading for the item or gloss column in a glossary list or similar structured list.包含詞彙列表或結構類似的列表中項目或註解欄位的標題。
headLabel
heading for list labels列表標籤的標題
contains the heading for the label or term column in a glossary list or similar structured list.包含詞彙列表或結構類似的列表中標籤或專有名詞欄位的標題。
hi
highlighted顯目標示
marks a word or phrase as graphically distinct from the surrounding text, for reasons concerning which no claim is made. 標誌其字型外觀上和週遭文字有所區別的字詞，但不指出顯目原因。
imprint
groups information relating to the publication or distribution of a bibliographic item.匯集書目項目的出版或發行相關資訊。
index
index entry索引項目
marks a location to be indexed for whatever purpose.標誌一個因某種目的而被索引的位置。
 
 @indexName
supplies a name to specify which index (of several) the index entry belongs to.提供該索引項目所屬索引名稱。
item
contains one component of a list.包含列表中的一個項目。
l
verse line詩行
contains a single, possibly incomplete, line of verse.包含詩文的一行，也許是不完整的詩行。
 
 @part
specifies whether or not the line is metrically complete. 說明詩行的韻律表現是否完整。
 
  Y
yesNo zh-tw for "yes"
the line is metrically incomplete韻律表現不完整的詩行
  N
noNo zh-tw for "no"
either the line is complete, or no claim is made as to its completeness詩行完整或未說明其完整性
  I
initialNo zh-tw for "initial"
the initial part of an incomplete line不完整詩行的起始部分
  M
medialNo zh-tw for "medial"
a medial part of an incomplete line不完整詩行的中段部分
  F
finalNo zh-tw for "final"
the final part of an incomplete line不完整詩行的末端部分
label
contains the label associated with an item in a list; in glossaries, marks the term being defined.包含和列表中某項目相關聯的標號；在詞彙表中則用來標記被定義的字詞。
lb
line break分行
marks the start of a new (typographic) line in some edition or version of a text.標記某版本文本裡 (在印刷上) 的新起行。
 
 @ed
editionNo zh-tw for "edition"
indicates the edition or version in which the line break is located at this point指出該分行位於哪一個版本
lg
line group行組
contains a group of verse lines functioning as a formal unit, e.g. a stanza, refrain, verse paragraph, etc.包含形式上視為一組的詩行，例如詩節、疊句、韻文段落等。
list
contains any sequence of items organized as a list.包含以列表方式呈現的任何連續項目。
 
 @type
describes the form of the list.描述列表的形式。
 
  ordered
list items are numbered or lettered. 列表項目以數字或字母依順序排列。
  bulleted
list items are marked with a bullet or other typographic device. 列表項目以黑點或其他印刷符號排列。
  simple
list items are not numbered or bulleted. 列表項目的排列沒有用數字或任何其他符號作標記。
  gloss
each list item glosses some term or concept, which is given by a label element preceding the list item.各列表項目為一些字詞或概念下註解，每個項目之前並帶有標籤元素。
listBibl
citation list書目列表
contains a list of bibliographic citations of any kind. 包含任何種類的書目資料列表。
measure
contains a word or phrase referring to some quantity of an object or commodity, usually comprising a number, a unit, and a commodity name.包含用來表示某物品數量的字詞，通常是由數字、單位和物品名稱所組成。
 
 @type
specifies the type of measurement in any convenient typology.用任何適合的分類方法來說明度量的種類。
measureGrp
measure groupNo zh-tw for "measure group"
contains a group of dimensional specifications which relate to the same object, for example the height and width of a manuscript page.No zh-tw for "contains a group of dimensional specifications which relate to the same object, for example the height and width of a manuscript page."
meeting
contains the formalized descriptive title for a meeting or conference, for use in a bibliographic description for an item derived from such a meeting, or as a heading or preamble to publications emanating from it.在書目參照當中，標記該書目項目來源的會議相關描述。
mentioned
marks words or phrases mentioned, not used.標明被提及但意義上未被使用的字句。
milestone
marks a boundary point separating any kind of section of a text, as indicated by changes in a standard reference system, where the section is not represented by a structural element.標明文本中由標準參照系統變更所指示的任何區塊分界點，並且該章節未以任何結構性元素標記。
 
 @ed
editionNo zh-tw for "edition"
indicates the edition or version to which the milestone applies.指出該分界位於哪一版本。
 @unit
provides a conventional name for the kind of section changing at this milestone.提供此分界段落所使用的通用單位名稱。
 
  page
physical page breaks (synonymous with the pb element).分頁 (和元素pb同義) 。
  column
column breaks.分段。
  line
line breaks (synonymous with the lb element).分行 (和元素lb同義) 。
  book
any units termed book, liber, etc.所有稱為書、冊、或函等的單位。
  poem
individual poems in a collection.詩集中的單首詩。
  canto
cantos or other major sections of a poem.長詩的詩篇，或詩的大段落。
  stanza
stanzas within a poem, book, or canto.一首詩、一本書、或一詩篇中的詩節。
  act
acts within a play.劇本中的幕。
  scene
scenes within a play or act.劇本中的景。
  section
sections of any kind.任何種類的段落。
  absent
passages not present in the reference edition.該段文字未在參照版本中出現。
monogr
monographic level專題層書目
contains bibliographic elements describing an item (e.g. a book or journal) published as an independent item (i.e. as a separate physical object).包含某一項目 (例如書或期刊) 的書目元素， 該項目為一獨立出版品 (即未附屬於其他出版品) 。
name
name, proper noun名稱，特定名稱
contains a proper noun or noun phrase.包含一個特定名稱 或名詞詞組。
 
 @type
indicates the type of the object which is being named by the phrase.說明該名稱所表示項目的種類。
note
contains a note or annotation.包含附註或註釋。
 
 @type
describes the type of note.說明附註的種類。
 @resp
responsible partyNo zh-tw for "responsible party"
indicates who is responsible for the annotation: author, editor, translator, etc.指出該註釋的責任歸屬者：作者、編者或譯者等。
 @anchored
indicates whether the copy text shows the exact place of reference for the note.說明文本是否顯示附註的確切參照位置。
 @target
indicates the point (or points) of attachment for a note, or the beginning of the span to which the note is attached.指出一個 (或數個) 附註的所註點，或是所註範圍的起點。
 @targetEnd
points to the end of the span to which the note is attached, if the note is not embedded in the text at that point.如果附註不是嵌在正文中，則用以標明附註所註範圍的終點。
num
number數字
contains a number, written in any form.包含一個以任何形式呈現的數字。
 
 @type
indicates the type of numeric value.指出數值的種類。
 
  cardinal
absolute number, e.g. 21, 21.5絕對數，例如21、21.5
  ordinal
ordinal number, e.g. 21st序數，例如第21
  fraction
fraction, e.g. one half or three-quarters分數，例如二分之一或是四分之三
  percentage
a percentage百分比
 @value
supplies the value of the number in standard form.用標準形式來說明該數字所代表的值。
orig
original form原文格式
contains a reading which is marked as following the original, rather than being normalized or corrected.標誌原文中呈現的文字，並且未經過任何修改或規格化處理。
p
paragraph段落
marks paragraphs in prose.標記散文的段落。
pb
page break分頁
marks the boundary between one page of a text and the next in a standard reference system.以標準參照系統來標記頁與頁之間的分界線。
 
 @ed
editionNo zh-tw for "edition"
indicates the edition or version in which the page break is located at this point指出該分頁位於哪一版本
postBox
postal box or post office box郵政信箱
contains a number or other identifier for some postal delivery point other than a street address. 包含一個數字或其他識別名稱，標示街道地址之外的郵件寄送點。
postCode
postal code郵遞區號
contains a numerical or alphanumeric code used as part of a postal address to simplify sorting or delivery of mail. 包含一個數字或字母加數字的區域代碼，屬於郵寄地址的一部分，用以簡化郵件的分類及寄送工作。
ptr
pointer
defines a pointer to another location.標明一個與其他位置相連結的指標。
 
 @target
specifies the destination of the pointer by supplying one or more URI References提供一個或多個統一資源識別符參照 (URI References) 來具體說明指標所指的位置。
 @cRef
canonical referenceNo zh-tw for "canonical reference"
specifies the destination of the pointer by supplying a canonical reference from a scheme defined in a refsDecl element in the TEI header用元素refsDecl在TEI標頭內所定義的標準參照來說明指標所指位置。
pubPlace
publication place
contains the name of the place where a bibliographic item was published.包含書目項目的出版地名稱。
publisher
provides the name of the organization responsible for the publication or distribution of a bibliographic item.提供負責出版或發行書目項目的機構名稱。
q
separated from the surrounding text with quotation marks引用的言詞、思想、或文字
contains material which is marked as (ostensibly) being somehow different than the surrounding text, for any one of a variety of reasons including, but not limited to: direct speech or thought, technical terms or jargon, authorial distance, quotations from elsewhere, and passages that are mentioned but not used.包含標記為 (看似) 引用自他處的內容；在敘述文中，此元素用來標記直接或間接敘述；在字典中，用來標記實例或編者設計的範例；在寫本描述或其他上層資訊中，用來標記由來源文本中所摘錄的引文。
 
 @type
may be used to indicate whether the offset passage is spoken or thought, or to characterize it more finely.可用來指出引文內容為言詞或思想，或者做更詳細的引文描述。
 
  spoken
representation of speech表示直接敘述，通常會標上引號。
  thought
representation of thought, e.g. internal monologue表示思考內容，例如內心獨白。
  written
quotation from a written source引用自一份書面來源文件。
  soCalled
authorial distanceNo zh-tw for "authorial distance"
  foreign
foreign wordsNo zh-tw for "foreign words"
  distinct
linguistically distinctNo zh-tw for "linguistically distinct"
  term
technical termNo zh-tw for "technical term"
  emph
rhetorically emphasizedNo zh-tw for "rhetorically emphasized"
  mentioned
refering to itself, not its normal referantNo zh-tw for "refering to itself, not its normal referant"
quote
quotation引文
contains a phrase or passage attributed by the narrator or author to some agency external to the text.包含敘述者或作者引用自文本以外來源的字 (句) 詞或段落。
ref
reference
defines a reference to another location, possibly modified by additional text or comment.標明與其他位置互相參照的符號，或許包含附加的文字或註解。
 
 @target
specifies the destination of the reference by supplying one or more URI References用一個或多個統一資源識別符參照 (URI References) 來說明參照所指位置。
 @cRef
canonical referenceNo zh-tw for "canonical reference"
specifies the destination of the reference by supplying a canonical reference from a scheme defined in a refsDecl element in the TEI header用元素refsDecl在TEI標頭內所定義的標準參照來說明參照所指位置。
reg
regularization一般化
contains a reading which has been regularized or normalized in some sense.標誌一般化或規格化處理過的文字。
relatedItem
contains or references some other bibliographic item which is related to the present one in some specified manner, for example as a constituent or alternative version of it.包含或參照到其他書目項目，該些項目與目前的書目項目在某種程度上相關，例如作為其組成或者替代項目。
resp
responsibility
contains a phrase describing the nature of a person's intellectual responsibility.包含一個詞彙，來描述個人智慧責任的類型。
respStmt
statement of responsibility責任陳述
supplies a statement of responsibility for the intellectual content of a text, edition, recording, or series, where the specialized elements for authors, editors, etc. do not suffice or do not apply.當未使用作者、編輯者等特定元素，或元素內容不足時，在此補充說明文件、版本、記錄、或是叢書的智慧內容所屬負責人的責任陳述。
rs
referencing string參照字串
contains a general purpose name or referring string.包含一般名稱或參照字串。
 
 @type
indicates more specifically the object referred to by the referencing string. Values might include person, place, ship, element etc.更詳細指出參照字串所表示的對象。屬性值可包含person、place、ship、element等
said
speech or thoughtNo zh-tw for "speech or thought"
indicates passages thought or spoken aloud, whether explicitly indicated in the source or not, whether directly or indirectly reported, whether by real people or fictional characters.No zh-tw for "indicates passages thought or spoken aloud, whether explicitly indicated in the source or not, whether directly or indirectly reported, whether by real people or fictional characters."
 
 @aloud
may be used to indicate whether the quoted matter is regarded as having been vocalized or signed.No zh-tw for "may be used to indicate whether the quoted matter is regarded as having been vocalized or signed."
 @direct
may be used to indicate whether the quoted matter is regarded as direct or indirect speech.No zh-tw for "may be used to indicate whether the quoted matter is regarded as direct or indirect speech."
series
series information叢書資訊
contains information about the series in which a book or other bibliographic item has appeared.包含某書目項目所屬的叢書資訊。
sic
latin for thus or so
contains text reproduced although apparently incorrect or inaccurate.包含看似錯誤但仍照實轉錄的文本。
soCalled
contains a word or phrase for which the author or narrator indicates a disclaiming of responsibility, for example by the use of scare quotes or italics.作者或敘述者使用的字句在意義上另有所指的表現，例如諷刺所使用的引號或斜體標示。
sp
speech演說
An individual speech in a performance text, or a passage presented as such in a prose or verse text.劇本中的個人台詞，或散文、韻文中的個人演說。
speaker
A specialized form of heading or label, giving the name of one or more speakers in a dramatic text or fragment.一種特殊的標題或標籤形式，用來標示劇本中一位或多位講者名稱。
stage
stage direction舞台指示
contains any kind of stage direction within a dramatic text or fragment.包含劇本中任何一種舞台場景或演出動作指示。
 
 @type
indicates the kind of stage direction.指出舞台指示的種類。
 
  setting
describes a setting.描述舞台佈景。
  entrance
describes an entrance.描述角色進場。
  exit
describes an exit.描述角色退場。
  business
describes stage business.描述演員動作。
  novelistic
is a narrative, motivating stage direction.敘述性的，積極性的舞台指示。
  delivery
describes how a character speaks.描述演員說話方式。
  modifier
gives some detail about a character.提供一個角色的某些細節資訊。
  location
describes a location.描述場景位置。
  mixed
more than one of the above包含兩種以上的舞台指示類型。
street
a full street address including any name or number identifying a building as well as the name of the street or route on which it is located.完整的街道地址，包含任何名稱或數字，用以識別一棟建築物以及所在街道名稱。
teiCorpus
contains the whole of a TEI encoded corpus, comprising a single corpus header and one or more TEI elements, each containing a single text header and a text.包含一套用TEI編碼的文件集，由單一文集標頭以及一個 (或多個) TEI元素所組成，各TEI元素包含單一文本標頭和一個文本。
 
 @version
The version of the TEI schemeTEI架構的版本
term
contains a single-word, multi-word, or symbolic designation which is regarded as a technical term.包含作為專有名詞的一個單字、詞彙、或是表示符號。
 
 @target
identifies the associated gloss element by an absolute or relative URI referenceNo zh-tw for "identifies the associated gloss element by an absolute or relative URI reference"
 @cRef
identifies the associated gloss element using a canonical reference from a scheme defined in a refsDecl element in the TEI headerNo zh-tw for "identifies the associated gloss element using a canonical reference from a scheme defined in a refsDecl element in the TEI header"
 @sortKey
supplies the sort key for this term in an index.提供索引中該專有名詞的排序關鍵。
time
contains a phrase defining a time of day in any format.包含一組字詞，以任何形式定義時間
title
contains the full title of a work of any kind.包含任何種類作品的完整題名。
 
 @level
indicates the bibliographic level for a title, that is, whether it identifies an article, book, journal, series, or unpublished material.指出題名的書目層次，即該題名之所指可以是文章、書籍、期刊、叢書或未出版的項目。
 
  a
analyticNo zh-tw for "analytic"
analytic title (article, poem, or other item published as part of a larger item) 分析層題名 (文章、詩、或其他隸屬於一個較大作品的項目)
  m
monographicNo zh-tw for "monographic"
monographic title (book, collection, or other item published as a distinct item, including single volumes of multi-volume works) 專題層題名 (書、選集、或其他獨立出版的項目，包含多冊作品的其中一冊)
  j
journalNo zh-tw for "journal"
journal title 期刊層題名
  s
seriesNo zh-tw for "series"
series title 叢書層題名
  u
unpublishedNo zh-tw for "unpublished"
title of unpublished material (including theses and dissertations unless published by a commercial press)未出版的項目題名 (包括未經商業刊物發表的專題論文)
 @type
classifies the title according to some convenient typology.用合適的分類方法將題名分類。
 
  main
main title 主要題名
  sub
subordinateNo zh-tw for "subordinate"
subtitle, title of part 副題名、部分題名
  alt
alternateNo zh-tw for "alternate"
alternate title, often in another language, by which the work is also known 替代題名，通常以該作品著名的另一種語言呈現
  short
abbreviated form of title題名的縮寫形式
  desc
descriptiveNo zh-tw for "descriptive"
descriptive paraphrase of the work functioning as a title該作品的描述性改述，可作為題名
unclear
contains a word, phrase, or passage which cannot be transcribed with certainty because it is illegible or inaudible in the source.在來源文本中難以辨認或聽懂而無法確實轉錄的單字、詞組、或段落。
 
 @reason
indicates why the material is hard to transcribe.指出資料難以轉錄的原因。
 @hand
Where the difficulty in transcription arises from action (partial deletion, etc.) assignable to an identifiable hand, signifies the hand responsible for the action.若轉錄困難是由身分明確的執行者所造成 (例如部分刪除)，則在此表明執行者的身分。
 @agent
Where the difficulty in transcription arises from damage, categorizes the cause of the damage, if it can be identified.若因為內容遭受損毀而引起轉錄困難，且可辨別出損毀的導因，則在此加以說明。
 
  rubbing
damage results from rubbing of the leaf edges損毀起因於書頁邊緣摩擦受損
  mildew
damage results from mildew on the leaf surface損毀起因於書頁表面發霉
  smoke
damage results from smoke損毀起因於煙燻

4. [textstructure] Default text structure

4.1. Elements

TEI
TEI documentTEI文件
contains a single TEI-conformant document, comprising a TEI header and a text, either in isolation or as part of a teiCorpus element.包含符合TEI標準的單一文件，由一個TEI標頭及一份文本組成，可單獨出現或是作為元素teiCorpus的一部分。
 
 @version
The version of the TEI schemeTEI架構的版本
argument
A formal list or prose description of the topics addressed by a subdivision of a text.規則列表或文字敘述，說明文本分段內容包含的主題。
back
back matter正文後資訊
contains any appendixes, etc. following the main part of a text.在正文之後，包含附錄等。
body
text body正文
contains the whole body of a single unitary text, excluding any front or back matter.單篇文章的整體部分，不包含正文前及正文後資訊。
byline
contains the primary statement of responsibility given for a work on its title page or at the head or end of the work.包含作品的主要責任陳述，出現在題名頁或作品開頭或結尾處。
closer
groups together salutations, datelines, and similar phrases appearing as a final group at the end of a division, especially of a letter.匯集日期地點、署名、稱呼語、及其他在區段結尾出現的類似措辭，尤指信件結尾。
dateline
contains a brief description of the place, date, time, etc. of production of a letter, newspaper story, or other work, prefixed or suffixed to it as a kind of heading or trailer. 包含簡短的地點、日期及時間等的描述，通常出現在信件、報紙文章、或其他作品中的開頭或結尾，作為一種標頭或結尾。
div
text division文本區段
contains a subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.文本的正文前資訊、正文、及正文後資訊的分段。
div1
level-1 text division區段層次一
contains a first-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.文本的正文前資訊、正文及正文後資訊的第一層分段 (若未使用區段層次零，區段層次一是最高層的分段。若使用區段層次零，則區段層次一為第二層分段) 。
div2
level-2 text division區段層次二
contains a second-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.文本的正文前資訊、正文及正文後資訊的第二層分段。
div3
level-3 text division區段層次三
contains a third-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.文本的正文前資訊、正文及正文後資訊的第三層分段。
div4
level-4 text division區段層次四
contains a fourth-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.文本的正文前資訊、正文及正文後資訊的第四層分段。
div5
level-5 text division區段層次五
contains a fifth-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.文本的正文前資訊、正文及正文後資訊的第五層分段。
div6
level-6 text division區段層次六
contains a sixth-level subdivision of the front, body, or back of a text.文本的正文前資訊、正文及正文後資訊的第六層分段。
div7
level-7 text division區段層次七
contains the smallest possible subdivision of the front, body or back of a text, larger than a paragraph.文本的正文前資訊、正文及正文後資訊的最低層分段，分段層級高於段落。
docAuthor
document author文件作者
contains the name of the author of the document, as given on the title page (often but not always contained in a byline).包含文件作者名稱，同於題名頁上顯示的作者名 (經常但不一定出現在署名當中) 。
docDate
document date文件日期
contains the date of a document, as given (usually) on a title page.包含文件日期， 同於 (通常) 在題名頁上顯示的日期。
 
 @when
gives the value of the date in standard form, i.e. YYYY-MM-DD.No zh-tw for "gives the value of the date in standard form, i.e. YYYY-MM-DD."
docEdition
document edition文件版本
contains an edition statement as presented on a title page of a document.包含一份版本陳述，與文件題名頁所顯示的相同。
docImprint
document imprint文件出版說明
contains the imprint statement (place and date of publication, publisher name), as given (usually) at the foot of a title page.包含文件出版陳述 (出版日期、地點以及出版公司名稱) ，同於 (通常) 題名頁尾所顯示的出版資訊。
docTitle
document title文件題名
contains the title of a document, including all its constituents, as given on a title page.包含文件題名，包含所有組成部分，同於題名頁上所顯示的題名。
epigraph
contains a quotation, anonymous or attributed, appearing at the start of a section or chapter, or on a title page. 包含一段匿名或署名引文，出現在段落或章節的開頭，或在題名頁中。
floatingText
contains a single text of any kind, whether unitary or composite, which interrupts the text containing it at any point and after which the surrounding text resumes.包含一份任何種類的文本，無論是單一或複合的，該份文本任意穿插於整體文本中，而週遭文字則接續其後。
front
front matter正文前資訊
contains any prefatory matter (headers, title page, prefaces, dedications, etc.) found at the start of a document, before the main body.包含位於文件最前端、正文之前的項目 (標頭、題名頁、前言、獻詞等) 。
group
contains the body of a composite text, grouping together a sequence of distinct texts (or groups of such texts) which are regarded as a unit for some purpose, for example the collected works of an author, a sequence of prose essays, etc.包含複合文本的正文，所匯集的一連串單一文件 (或文件群組) ，因為某特殊目的被視為一個整體，例如一個作者的作品集合、一連串的散文集等。
imprimatur
contains a formal statement authorizing the publication of a work, sometimes required to appear on a title page or its verso.包含作品出版的正式授權聲明，有時必須出現在題名頁或反頁上。
opener
groups together dateline, byline, salutation, and similar phrases appearing as a preliminary group at the start of a division, especially of a letter.匯集日期地點、署名、稱呼語及其他在區段開端出現的類似措辭，尤指信件開頭。
postscript
contains a postscript, e.g. to a letter.No zh-tw for "contains a postscript, e.g. to a letter."
salute
salutation稱呼語
contains a salutation or greeting prefixed to a foreword, dedicatory epistle, or other division of a text, or the salutation in the closing of a letter, preface, etc.包含在序言、獻詞、或其他文本區段開頭的稱呼語或問候語，或是信件、引言等結尾處的致意詞。
signed
signature簽名
contains the closing salutation, etc., appended to a foreword, dedicatory epistle, or other division of a text. 包含結尾致意詞等，附加在序言、獻詞、或其他文本區段中。
text
contains a single text of any kind, whether unitary or composite, for example a poem or drama, a collection of essays, a novel, a dictionary, or a corpus sample.包含一份任何種類的文本，無論是單一或複合的，例如詩詞或戲劇、散文集、小說、字典、或是文集範例。
titlePage
title page題名頁
contains the title page of a text, appearing within the front or back matter. 包含文本的題名頁，出現在正文前資訊或正文後資訊之中。
 
 @type
classifies the title page according to any convenient typology.將題名頁分類。
titlePart
contains a subsection or division of the title of a work, as indicated on a title page.包含作品題名的部分或區段，同於題名頁上所標示的題名。
 
 @type
specifies the role of this subdivision of the title.說明該題名部分的作用。
 
  main
main title of the work 作品主要題名
  sub
subordinateNo zh-tw for "subordinate"
subtitle of the work 作品次要題名
  alt
alternateNo zh-tw for "alternate"
alternative title of the work 作品代換題名
  short
abbreviated form of title題名的縮寫形式
  desc
descriptiveNo zh-tw for "descriptive"
descriptive paraphrase of the work 作品的描述性改述
trailer
contains a closing title or footer appearing at the end of a division of a text. 包含文本中一個區段結束時的結尾題名或尾錄。

5. [gaiji] Character and glyph documentation

5.1. Elements

char
character文字
provides descriptive information about a character. 提供一個文字的描述性資訊。
charDecl
character declarations文字描述
provides information about nonstandard characters and glyphs. 提供文字或字體的描述性資訊。
charName
character name文字名稱
contains the name of a character, expressed following Unicode conventions. 包含一文字名稱，其表示法根據統一碼協定 (Unicode)。
charProp
character property文字性質
provides a name and value for some property of the parent character or glyph. 提供父文字或字體的性質名稱與性質值。
g
character or glyph文字或字體
represents a non-standard character or glyph.非標準的文字或字體。
 
 @ref
points to a description of the character or glyph intended.連結到該文字或字體的描述。
glyph
character glyph文字的形體
provides descriptive information about a character glyph. 提供一種字體的描述性資訊。
glyphName
character glyph name字體名稱
contains the name of a glyph, expressed following Unicode conventions for character names. 包含一字體名稱，其表示法根據統一碼協定 (Unicode)。
localName
locally-defined property name當地定義的性質名稱
contains a locally defined name for some property. 包含某性質的地方性定義名稱。
mapping
character mapping文字對應
contains one or more characters which are related to the parent character or glyph in some respect, as specified by the type attribute. 包含與父文字或字體在某方面有所關聯的一個或多個文字，在屬性type中加以說明。
unicodeName
unicode property name統一碼性質名稱
contains the name of a registered Unicode normative or informative property. 包含一個統一碼規範性質之註冊名稱。
 
 @version
specifies the version number of the Unicode Standard in which this property name is defined.說明該性質名稱是定義在哪一版本的統一碼標準 (Unicode Standard) 中。
value
value性質值
contains a single value for some property, attribute, or other analysis.包含一個性質值、屬性值、或其他分析值。

6. [verse] Verse structures

6.1. Attribute classes

att.enjamb
enjambement詩句跨行
groups elements bearing the enjamb attribute.匯集帶有屬性enjamb的元素。
 
 @enjamb
enjambementNo zh-tw for "enjambement"
indicates that the end of a verse line is marked by enjambement.指出詩行末端帶有詩句跨行的標記。
 
  no
the line is end-stopped 該詩句在行尾結束
  yes
the line in question runs on into the next 該詩句延續到下一詩行
  weak
the line is weakly enjambed 詩句弱跨行
  strong
the line is strongly enjambed詩句強跨行
att.metrical
defines a set of attributes which certain elements may use to represent metrical information. 定義一組特定元素所使用、表示詩行韻律的屬性。
 
 @met
metrical structure, conventionalNo zh-tw for "metrical structure, conventional"
contains a user-specified encoding for the conventional metrical structure of the element.包含使用者定義的標記，用於一般韻律結構。
 @real
metrical structure, realizedNo zh-tw for "metrical structure, realized"
contains a user-specified encoding for the actual realization of the conventional metrical structure applicable to the element.包含使用者定義的標記，適用於一般標記結構的實際表現情形。
 @rhyme
rhyme schemeNo zh-tw for "rhyme scheme"
specifies the rhyme scheme applicable to a group of verse lines.標明適用於一詩行組的押韻組合。

att.enjamb
enjambement詩句跨行

 @enjamb

6.3. Elements

caesura
marks the point at which a metrical line may be divided.標記韻律詩行可能被截斷的位置。
metDecl
metrical notation declaration
documents the notation employed to represent a metrical pattern when this is specified as the value of a met, real, or rhyme attribute on any structural element of a metrical text (e.g. lg, l, or seg).在標記韻文時所用到的結構性元素 (例如lg、l、或seg) 當中，若使用met、real、或rhyme等屬性的屬性值來表示文章的韻律模式，則在此宣告標記韻律模式的方法。
 
 @type
indicates whether the notation conveys the abstract metrical form, its actual prosodic realization, or the rhyme scheme, or some combination thereof.指出該標記所傳達的為抽象韻律形式、實際韻律實踐、或者押韻形式，或任幾項之結合。
 
  met
met attribute屬性met
declaration applies to the abstract metrical form recorded on the met attribute屬性 met宣告適用於該屬性所紀錄的抽象韻律形式。
  real
real attribute屬性real
declaration applies to the actual realization of the conventional metrical structure recorded on the real attribute屬性real宣告適用於該屬性所紀錄的通用韻律結構之實際實踐
  rhyme
rhyme attributeNo zh-tw for "rhyme attribute"
declaration applies to the rhyme scheme recorded on the rhyme attributeNo zh-tw for "declaration applies to the rhyme scheme recorded on the rhyme attribute"
 @pattern
regular expression patternNo zh-tw for "regular expression pattern"
specifies a regular expression defining any value that is legal for this notation.標明一種固定表示法，用來定義任何合用於此標記的屬性值。
metSym
metrical notation symbol
documents the intended significance of a particular character or character sequence within a metrical notation, either explicitly or in terms of other symbol elements in the same metDecl.說明在標記韻律模式時使用的特定符號或符號序列所代表的意義，可以是明確的文字闡釋，或是加以解釋同ㄧ個韻律宣告中其他韻律符號元素的內容。
 
 @value
specifies the character or character sequence being documented.標明所紀錄的符號或符號序列。
 @terminal
specifies whether the symbol is defined in terms of other symbols (terminal is set to false) or in prose (terminal is set to true).標明該符號是否以其他符號來定義 (terminal為false) 或以散文描述 (terminal為true)
rhyme
marks the rhyming part of a metrical line.標記韻律詩行的押韻部分。
 
 @label
provides a label to identify which part of a rhyme scheme this rhyming string instantiates.提供一個標籤，識別此韻腳為押韻組合的哪一部份。

7. [drama] Performance texts

actor
Name of an actor appearing within a cast list.角色名單中的演員姓名。

cast list grouping角色群組
groups one or more individual castItem elements within a cast list.匯集角色清單中一個或多個角色項目元素。

cast list item角色項目
contains a single entry within a cast list, describing either a single role or a list of non-speaking roles.包含角色清單中的一個項目，描述單一角色或無台詞角色的列表。

 @perf

contains a section of front or back matter describing how a dramatic piece is to be performed in general or how it was performed on some specific occasion. 包含前頁或後頁部分，描述戲劇作品的一般演出方式、或曾經在某些特定場合的演出方式。
prologue
contains the prologue to a drama, typically spoken by an actor out of character, possibly in association with a particular performance or venue.包含戲劇開場白，可能和特定演出或故事場景相關，一般是由一個演員脫離劇中身份來朗讀。

contains a description of the setting, time, locale, appearance, etc., of the action of a play, typically found in the front matter of a printed performance text (not a stage direction).包含一段演出的場景描述，像是佈景、時間、地點、景象等，這段描述通常出現在劇本中的前頁部分 (並非舞台動作指示) 。
sound
describes a sound effect or musical sequence specified within a screen play or radio script.描述電影或廣播劇本中的音效或配樂。

 @perf

8. [spoken] Transcribed Speech

8.1. Attribute classes

att.duration
provides attributes for normalization of elements that contain datable events.提供用於元素規格化的屬性，這些元素包含日期明確的事件。

8.2. Model classes

att.duration
provides attributes for normalization of elements that contain datable events.提供用於元素規格化的屬性，這些元素包含日期明確的事件。

8.3. Elements

broadcast
describes a broadcast used as the source of a spoken text.描述口說文本的公開播送影音來源相關資訊。
equipment
provides technical details of the equipment and media used for an audio or video recording used as the source for a spoken text.提供錄製設備及媒介的技術性細節，該設備及媒介用於口說文本來源之影像或聲音錄製。
incident
any phenomenon or occurrence, not necessarily vocalized or communicative, for example incidental noises or other events affecting communication.No zh-tw for "any phenomenon or occurrence, not necessarily vocalized or communicative, for example incidental noises or other events affecting communication."
kinesic
any communicative phenomenon, not necessarily vocalized, for example a gesture, frown, etc.任何溝通現象，未必是口說表達，例如手勢、皺眉等。
 
 @iterated
indicates whether or not the phenomenon is repeated.指出該現象是否重複發生。
pause
a pause either between or within utterances.說話之間或說話時的停頓。
recording
recording event影音錄製
details of an audio or video recording event used as the source of a spoken text, either directly or from a public broadcast. 包含口說文本的影像或聲音來源錄製細節，該來源可以是直接錄製或是經由公開播放的管道取得。
 
 @type

  audio
audio recording聲音錄製
  video
audio and video recording聲音及影像錄製
recordingStmt
recording statement影音陳述
describes a set of recordings used as the basis for transcription of a spoken text.當所轉錄的口說文本來源為影音檔案時，在此描述影音錄製的相關資訊。
scriptStmt
script statement腳本陳述
contains a citation giving details of the script used for a spoken text.包含口說文本的來源腳本相關細節。
shift
marks the point at which some paralinguistic feature of a series of utterances by any one speaker changes.所標記的位置表示任一說話者在一連串說話中，某些附屬語言特性的改變。
 
 @feature
a paralinguistic feature.附屬語言特性
 
  tempo
speed of utterance. 說話速度
  loud
loudness. 音量
  pitch
pitch range. 音調範圍
  tension
tension or stress pattern. 張力或強調模式
  rhythm
rhythmic qualities. 節奏品質
  voice
voice quality. 聲音品質
 @new
specifies the new state of the paralinguistic feature specified.說明改變後的附屬語言特性狀況。
u
utterance話語
a stretch of speech usually preceded and followed by silence or by a change of speaker.一段言詞，通常在說話前後是一段沉默、或是另一個人的說話。
 
 @trans
transitionNo zh-tw for "transition"
indicates the nature of the transition between this utterance and the previous one.指出此段話語和前段話語之間轉變過程的特性。
 
  smooth
this utterance begins without unusual pause or rapidity.此段話語的開頭並無異常停頓或異常迅速。
  latching
this utterance begins with a markedly shorter pause than normal.此段話語開頭的停頓明顯比平常要短。
  overlap
this utterance begins before the previous one has finished.此段話語在前一段還未結束前就開始。
  pause
this utterance begins after a noticeable pause.此段話語在一段明顯的停頓之後開始。
vocal
any vocalized but not necessarily lexical phenomenon, for example voiced pauses, non-lexical backchannels, etc.發出聲音但未必是詞彙的話語，例如有聲的停頓、非詞彙的附應等。
 
 @iterated
indicates whether or not the phenomenon is repeated.指出該現象是否重複發生。
writing
a passage of written text revealed to participants in the course of a spoken text.在口說的過程中，參與者可觀看的一段書面文字。
 
 @source
points to a bibliographic citation in the header giving a full description of the source or script of the writing.No zh-tw for "points to a bibliographic citation in the header giving a full description of the source or script of the writing."
 @gradual
indicates whether the writing is revealed all at once or gradually.指出該書面文字是一次全部出現或逐步出現

9. [dictionaries] Printed dictionaries

9.1. Attribute classes

att.entryLike

 @type

  main

  hom
homographNo zh-tw for "homograph"

  xref

a reduced entry whose only function is to point to another main entry (e.g. for forms of an irregular verb or for variant spellings: was pointing to be, or esthete to aesthete).縮減的辭條，其唯一作用為指向另一個主要辭條 (例如不規則動辭形式或不同拼法的字)
  affix

  abbr

  foreign

 @sortKey

 @norm

 @split

 @value
gives a value which lacks any realization in the printed source text.提供一個尚未在書面來源文件中呈現的屬性值
 @orig
originalNo zh-tw for "original"
gives the original string or is the empty string when the element does not appear in the source text.當該元素未出現於來源文件中，提供其原文字串或空白字串。
 @location
provides a reference to an anchor element elsewhere in the document indicating the original location of this component.參照到文件中的元素anchor，指出此元件的原文位置。
 @mergedIn
gives a reference to another element, where the original appears as a merged form.No zh-tw for "gives a reference to another element, where the original appears as a merged form."
 @opt
optionalNo zh-tw for "optional"
indicates whether the element is optional or not指出該元素是否必備
att.ptrLike.form
form pointers形式指標
common attributes for elements in the dictionary base which point at orthographic or pronunciation forms of the headword.用於該字典中元素的通用屬性，這些元素指向標題字的拼字或發音形式。
 
 @target
identifies the orthographic form or pronunciation referred to.標明所參照的拼字形式或發音。

9.2. Model classes

att.entryLike
groups the different styles of dictionary entries.匯集不同格式的字典辭條
 
 @type
indicates type of entry, in dictionaries with multiple types.指出複合類型字典中的辭條類型。
 
  main
a main entry (default).主要辭條 (預設) 。
  hom
homographNo zh-tw for "homograph"
groups information relating to one homograph within an entry.個別的同形義異字辭條。
  xref
cross referenceNo zh-tw for "cross reference"
a reduced entry whose only function is to point to another main entry (e.g. for forms of an irregular verb or for variant spellings: was pointing to be, or esthete to aesthete).縮減的辭條，其唯一作用為指向另一個主要辭條 (例如不規則動辭形式或不同拼法的字)
  affix
an entry for a prefix, infix, or suffix.字首、字中或字尾的辭條
  abbr
abbreviationNo zh-tw for "abbreviation"
an entry for an abbreviation.縮寫辭條
  supplemental
a supplemental entry (for use in dictionaries which issue supplements to their main work in which they include updated information about entries).補充辭條 ()
  foreign
an entry for a foreign word in a monolingual dictionary.單語字典中的外來語辭條。
 @sortKey
contains a (sortable) character sequence reflecting the entry's alphabetical position in the printed dictionary.包含一 (合適的) 符號序列，呈現該辭條在字典裡的字母次序相關位置。
att.lexicographic
defines a set of global attributes available on elements in the base tag set for dictionaries.定義一組全域屬性值，可用於字典的基礎標籤組之元素上。
 
 @expand
gives an expanded form of information presented more concisely in the dictionary提供一形式擴充的資訊，其以較簡潔的方式呈現於字典中
 @norm
normalizedNo zh-tw for "normalized"
gives a normalized form of information given by the source text in a non-normalized form提供一規格化形式的資訊，其來源文件為非規格化形式
 @split
gives the list of split values for a merged form提供一合併形式的split值列表
 @value
gives a value which lacks any realization in the printed source text.提供一個尚未在書面來源文件中呈現的屬性值
 @orig
originalNo zh-tw for "original"
gives the original string or is the empty string when the element does not appear in the source text.當該元素未出現於來源文件中，提供其原文字串或空白字串。
 @location
provides a reference to an anchor element elsewhere in the document indicating the original location of this component.參照到文件中的元素anchor，指出此元件的原文位置。
 @mergedIn
gives a reference to another element, where the original appears as a merged form.No zh-tw for "gives a reference to another element, where the original appears as a merged form."
 @opt
optionalNo zh-tw for "optional"
indicates whether the element is optional or not指出該元素是否必備

 @target

9.3. Elements

case
contains grammatical case information given by a dictionary for a given form.包含文法上格的資訊。

gram

within an entry in a dictionary or a terminological data file, contains grammatical information relating to a term, word, or form.在字典辭條或專有名詞檔案中，包含某一術語、單字或字彙形式的相關文法資訊。
 
 @type
classifies the grammatical information given according to some convenient typology — in the case of terminological information, preferably the dictionary of data element types specified in ISO WD 12 620.用合適的分類方法將不同的文法資訊加以分類－若是專門術語，可參照 ISO WD 12620 所指定資料元素類別。
 
  pos
part of speechNo zh-tw for "part of speech"
any of the word classes to which a word may be assigned in a given language, based on form, meaning, or a combination of features, e.g. noun, verb, adjective, etc.詞性 (在已知語言中的詞性分類，根據字詞的形式、意義或特性組合而有所不同。例如名詞、動詞、形容詞等。)
  gen
genderNo zh-tw for "gender"
formal classification by which nouns and pronouns, and often accompanying modifiers, are grouped and inflected, or changed in form, so as to control certain syntactic relationships性別 (名詞、代名詞、或伴隨的修飾詞透過這樣的規則系統在表現形式上被加以分組、或產生屈折變化，以展現特定的語法關係。)
  num
numberNo zh-tw for "number"
grammatical number, e.g. singular, plural, dual, …單複數 (例如單數、複數、雙數詞等)
  animate

  proper

gramGrp

groups morpho-syntactic information about a lexical item, e.g. pos, gen, number, case, or iType (inflectional class).匯集文字的型態及句法資訊，例如詞性、性別、單複數、格、或屈折變化種類。
hom

hyph
