10. [msdescription] Manuscript Description

10.1. Attribute classes

att.msExcerpt
manuscript excerpt手稿摘錄
provides attributes used to describe excerpts from a manuscript placed in a description thereof.提供用來描述關於手稿摘錄的屬性
 
 @defective
indicates whether the passage being quoted is defective, i.e. incomplete through loss or damage.指出所引用的段落是否不完全，例如因遺失或損毀而不完全。

10.2. Model classes

att.msExcerpt
manuscript excerpt手稿摘錄
provides attributes used to describe excerpts from a manuscript placed in a description thereof.提供用來描述關於手稿摘錄的屬性
 
 @defective
indicates whether the passage being quoted is defective, i.e. incomplete through loss or damage.指出所引用的段落是否不完全，例如因遺失或損毀而不完全。

10.3. Elements

accMat
accompanying material伴隨資料
contains details of any significant additional material which may be closely associated with the manuscript being described, such as non-contemporaneous documents or fragments bound in with the manuscript at some earlier historical period.包含可能與該手稿關係密切的重要附加資料之細節，例如非同時期的文件或是在早期與手稿裝訂一起的片段。
acquisition
contains any descriptive or other information concerning the process by which a manuscript or manuscript part entered the holding institution. 包含任何描述性或其他資訊，關於手稿或手稿部分進入保管機構的過程。
additional
groups additional information, combining bibliographic information about a manuscript, or surrogate copies of it with curatorial or administrative information. 匯集附加資訊，結合手稿的書目資訊、或是手稿的代替副本，包含管理或行政資訊。
additions
contains a description of any significant additions found within a manuscript, such as marginalia or other annotations. 包含手稿中任何重要增添文字的描述，例如旁註或其他註釋。
adminInfo
administrative information行政資訊
contains information about the present custody and availability of the manuscript, and also about the record description itself. 包含手稿現在的保管與可利用性資訊，也包含本身的紀錄描述。
altIdentifier
alternative identifier替換識別符碼
contains an alternative or former structured identifier used for a manuscript, such as a former catalogue number.包含手稿中的一個替換或先前使用的識別符碼，例如先前的分類碼。
binding
contains a description of one binding, i.e. type of covering, boards, etc. applied to a manuscript.一個裝訂的描述，例如使用於該手稿的封面類型、封面等。
 
 @contemporary
specifies whether or not the binding is contemporary with the majority of its contents說明裝訂和其大部分內容是否出於同一時期。
bindingDesc
binding description
describes the present and former bindings of a manuscript, either as a series of paragraphs or as a series of distinct binding elements, one for each binding of the manuscript. 描述手稿現在與之前的裝訂，可以是連續性的文字段落、或是一連串專用的binding元素，每個手稿裝訂使用一個元素。
catchwords
describes the system used to ensure correct ordering of the quires making up a codex or incunable, typically by means of annotations at the foot of the page.描述一疊書頁裝訂成手抄本或書冊時，確保書頁順序無誤的方法，通常是利用頁腳的註記。
collation
contains a description of how the leaves or bifolia are physically arranged.描述頁面紙張的排列組成。
collection
contains the name of a collection of manuscripts, not necessarily located within a single repository. 包含手稿集合的名稱，手稿未必皆位於單一收藏點。
colophon
contains the colophon of a manuscript item: that is, a statement providing information regarding the date, place, agency, or reason for production of the manuscript.包含一個手稿項目的 版權頁標記：即提供日期、地點、代理機構、或手稿產生原因等資訊的聲明。
condition
contains a description of the physical condition of the manuscript. 包含手稿材質狀況的描述。
custEvent
custodial event
describes a single event during the custodial history of a manuscript.描述手稿保管歷史中的單一事件。
custodialHist
custodial history
contains a description of a manuscript's custodial history, either as running prose or as a series of dated custodial events. 包含手稿保管歷史的描述，可以是篇章、或是一連串註明日期的保管事件。
decoDesc
decoration description
contains a description of the decoration of a manuscript, either as a sequence of paragraphs, or as a sequence of topically organised decoNote elements.包含手稿的裝飾描述，可以是連續性的文字段落、或是一連串依主題排列的裝飾附註元素。
decoNote
note on decoration
contains a note describing either a decorative component of a manuscript, or a fairly homogenous class of such components.包含一個附註，描述手稿的裝飾性要素、或是該類要素的同等分類。
depth
specifies a length measured across the spine. 橫跨書脊的測量值。
dimensions
contains a dimensional specification.尺寸的詳細說明。
 
 @type
indicates which aspect of the object is being measured. 指出物件被測量的部分。
 
  leaves
dimensions relate to one or more leaves (e.g. a single leaf, a gathering, or a separately bound part)一張或多張頁面的尺寸大小 (例如單一頁面、聚集頁面、或分開裝訂的部份)
  ruled
dimensions relate to the area of a leaf which has been ruled in preparation for writing.頁面上劃好線以備書寫的範圍大小。
  pricked
dimensions relate to the area of a leaf which has been pricked out in preparation for ruling (used where this differs significantly from the ruled area, or where the ruling is not measurable).頁面上刺好記號以備劃線的範圍大小 (用在和畫線範圍不同的位置，或是畫線無法測量的位置) 。
  written
dimensions relate to the area of a leaf which has been written, with the height measured from the top of the minims on the top line of writing, to the bottom of the minims on the bottom line of writing.頁面上已書寫文字的範圍大小，高度由最頂行文字的頂端測量至最底行文字的底端。
  miniatures
dimensions relate to the miniatures within the manuscript手稿中圖畫的尺寸大小
  binding
dimensions relate to the binding in which the codex or manuscript is contained手抄本或手稿裝訂的尺寸大小
  box
dimensions relate to the box or other container in which the manuscript is stored.手稿所儲存的箱子或其他容器的尺寸大小
explicit
contains the explicit of a manuscript item, that is, the closing words of the text proper, exclusive of any rubric or colophon which might follow it. 包含手稿項目中的 結尾語，即文本完成時的結尾語，不包含可能出現在其後的按語或版權頁標記。
filiation
contains information concerning the manuscript's filiation, i.e. its relationship to other surviving manuscripts of the same text, its protographs, antigraphs and apographs.包含手稿的來歷相關資訊，例如該手稿和其他相同文字內容的現存手稿之間的關係、以及該手稿的原稿、 抄本、以及謄本。
finalRubric
contains the string of words that denotes the end of a text division, often with an assertion as to its author and title, usually set off from the text itself by red ink, by a different size or type of script, or by some other such visual device.包含表示該文字區段結尾的字串，常有作者及標題的聲明，通常使用紅墨水、不同的字型與大小、或用其他不同視覺效果的圖案，來與文件本身作區別。
foliation
describes the numbering system or systems used to count the leaves or pages in a codex.描述計算手抄本紙張頁數的一種或多種編號系統。
handDesc
description of hands
contains a description of all the different kinds of writing used in a manuscript.手稿中使用的所有不同書寫種類的描述。
 
 @hands
specifies the number of distinct hands identified within the manuscript說明在手稿中可清楚識別的書寫者人數。
height
contains a measurement measured along the axis parallel to the spine. 沿著與書脊平行的軸線所量出的測量值。
heraldry
contains a heraldic formula or phrase, typically found as part of a blazon, coat of arms, etc. 包含一個紋章學的常規或詞彙，通常是裝飾、或盾形紋章等的一部分。
history
groups elements describing the full history of a manuscript or manuscript part.匯集描述手稿或手稿部分完整歷史的元素。
incipit
contains the incipit of a manuscript item, that is the opening words of the text proper, exclusive of any rubric which might precede it, of sufficient length to identify the work uniquely; such incipts were, in fomer times, frequently used a means of reference to a work, in place of a title.包含手稿項目中的起始語，即文本開端的起始語，不包括可能出現在之前的按語，並以充分的文字來獨家識別該作品；早期，這種起始語常用為作品的參照工具，出現在標題部份。
institution
contains the name of an organization such as a university or library, with which a manuscript is identified, generally its holding institution.包含一個組織名稱，例如大學或圖書館，手稿屬於該組織，通常是手稿所在地。
layout
describes how text is laid out on the page, including information about any ruling, pricking, or other evidence of page-preparation techniques.描述文字在頁面上的編排，包括任何橫隔線、刺痕、或其他的頁面準備技術的資訊。
 
 @columns
specifies the number of columns per page說明每頁的欄數
 @ruledLines
specifies the number of ruled lines per column說明每欄的橫隔線數
 @writtenLines
specifies the number of written lines per colum說明每欄的書寫行數
layoutDesc
layout description
collects the set of layout descriptions applicable to a manuscript.收集一組適當的手稿外觀編排描述。
locus
defines a location within a manuscript or manuscript part, usually as a (possibly discontinuous) sequence of folio references. 定義一個手稿或手稿部分裡的位置，通常是用一系列的 (可能不連續的) 頁面參照。
 
 @scheme
identifies the foliation scheme in terms of which the location is being specified.說明所指出位置的編頁架構。
 @from
specifies the starting point of the location in a normalized form.用正規格式指明該位置的起始點。
 @to
specifies the end-point of the location in a normalized form.用正規格式指明該位置的結束點。
 @target
supplies a link to one or more transcriptions of the specified range of folios.No zh-tw for "supplies a link to one or more transcriptions of the specified range of folios."
material
contains a word or phrase describing the material of which a manuscript (or part of a manuscript) is composed. 用一個字詞描述手稿 (或手稿部分) 的組成材料。
msContents
manuscript contentsNo zh-tw for "manuscript contents"
describes the intellectual content of a manuscript or manuscript part, either as a series of paragraphs or as a series of structured manuscript items.描述手稿或手稿部分的智慧內容，可以是一系列的文字段落，或是一系列有組織的手稿項目。
 
 @class
identifies the text types or classifications applicable to this object.標明適合的文字類型或分類。
msDesc
manuscript description
contains a description of a single identifiable manuscript.包含單一份可識別手稿的描述。
msIdentifier
manuscript identifier
contains the information required to identify the manuscript being described. 包含識別敘述中的手稿所需要的資訊。
msItem
manuscript item
describes an individual work or item within the intellectual content of a manuscript or manuscript part. 描述手稿或手稿部分的智慧內容中所包含的單一作品或項目。
 
 @class
identifies the text types or classifications applicable to this item標明適合的文字類型或分類。
msItemStruct
structured manuscript item
contains a structured description for an individual work or item within the intellectual content of a manuscript or manuscript part.包含某單一作品或項目的結構性描述，該作品或項目存在於手稿或手稿部分的智慧內容中。
 
 @class
identifies the text types or classifications applicable to this item標明適合的文字類型或分類。
msName
alternative name替換名稱
contains any form of unstructured alternative name used for a manuscript, such as an ocellus nominum, or nickname. 包含手稿無特定結構的任何形式替換名稱，像是ocellus nominum或是暱稱。
msPart
manuscript part
contains information about an originally distinct manuscript or part of a manuscript, now forming part of a composite manuscript.包含原為單一、現為複合手稿一部份的手稿或手稿部分的相關資訊。
musicNotation
contains description of type of musical notation.包含樂譜種類的描述。
objectDesc
contains a description of the physical components making up the object which is being described.包含討論中物件的材質組成成分描述。
 
 @form
a short project-specific name identifying the physical form of the carrier, for example as a codex, roll, fragment, partial leaf, cutting etc.一個簡短的用途專用名稱，表示該媒介的物質外形，例如手抄本、名冊、斷片、部分頁面、剪報等。
origDate
origin date
contains any form of date, used to identify the date of origin for a manuscript or manuscript part. 包含任何格式的日期，用以確認手稿或手稿部分的來源日期。
origPlace
origin place
contains any form of place name, used to identify the place of origin for a manuscript or manuscript part. 包含任何格式的地名，用以確認手稿或手稿部分的來源地點。
origin
contains any descriptive or other information concerning the origin of a manuscript or manuscript part. 包含關於手稿或手稿部分的來源之任何描述性或其他資訊。
physDesc
physical description
contains a full physical description of a manuscript or manuscript part, optionally subdivided using more specialised elements from the model.physDescPart class.包含一個手稿或手稿部分的完整材質描述，可以利用model.physDescPart class中的專門元素選擇性地再分類。
provenance
contains any descriptive or other information concerning a single identifiable episode during the history of a manuscript or manuscript part, after its creation but before its acquisition. 包含任何描述性或其他資訊，關於手稿或手稿部分的歷史中單一可確認的事件，發生在手稿產生之後、取得之前。
recordHist
recorded history
provides information about the source and revision status of the parent manuscript description itself. 提供父手稿本身說明的出處與修訂狀態相關資訊。
repository
contains the name of a repository within which manuscripts are stored, possibly forming part of an institution.包含該手稿收藏所在地的名稱，可能是某機構的一部分。
rubric
contains the text of any rubric or heading attached to a particular manuscript item, that is, a string of words through which a manuscript signals the beginning of a text division, often with an assertion as to its author and title, which is in some way set off from the text itself, usually in red ink, or by use of different size or type of script, or some other such visual device.包含任何按語的文字或是附在特殊手稿項目的標題，即手稿用來指示文字區段開始的字串，常有作者及標題的聲明，通常使用紅墨水、不同的字型與大小、或用其他不同視覺效果的圖案，來跟文件本身作區別。
seal
contains a description of one seal or similar attachment applied to a manuscript.描述一個章印或其他附於手稿的類似項目
 
 @contemporary
specifies whether or not the seal is contemporary with the item to which it is affixed說明該章印和其附著的項目是否出於同一時期。
sealDesc
seal description
describes the seals or other external items attached to a manuscript, either as a series of paragraphs or as a series of distinct seal elements, possibly with additional decoNotes. 描述章印或其他附於手稿的外部項目，可以是連續性的文字段落、或是一連串專用的印章元素，也許附上一些裝飾附註元素。
secFol
second folio
The word or words taken from a fixed point in a codex (typically the beginning of the second leaf) in order to provide a unique identifier for it. 從手抄本中固定位置所拿開的一個或多個字 (通常在第二張書頁的開頭) ，目的是提供一個專有的識別符號。
signatures
contains discussion of the leaf or quire signatures found within a codex.包含手抄本中一張或一疊書頁內簽名的敘述。
source
describes the original source for the information contained with a manuscript description. 描述關於手稿說明資訊的原始出處。
stamp
contains a word or phrase describing a stamp or similar device.包含一個字詞，描述一個印記或是類似圖案。
summary
contains a brief summary of the intellectual content of an item, provided by the cataloguer.包含由編目者所提供一份簡短概述，說明該項目的智慧內容。
support
contains a description of the materials etc. which make up the physical support for the written part of a manuscript.描述對於手稿書寫部分的物質載體所使用的材料等。
supportDesc
support description
groups elements describing the physical support for the written part of a manuscript.匯集描述手稿書寫部分的物質載體元素。
 
 @material
a short project-defined name for the material composing the majority of the support載體主要組成材料的簡短用途定義名稱
 
  paper
  parch
parchmentNo zh-tw for "parchment"
  mixed
surrogates
contains information about any digital or photographic representations of the manuscript being described which may exist in the holding institution or elsewhere. 包含關於任何手稿的數位化或攝影呈現的資訊，可能存在於保管機構或是其他地方。
textLang
text language
describes the languages and writing systems used by a manuscript (as opposed to its description, which is described in the langUsage element).描述手稿中所使用的語言和書寫系統 (相對於其描述時使用的語言使用元素) 。
 
 @mainLang
main language
supplies a code which identifies the chief language used in the manuscript.提供一代碼，識別手稿中使用的主要語言。
 @otherLangs
other languages
one or more codes identifying any other languages used in the manuscript.一個或多個代碼識別手稿中使用的任何其他語言。
watermark
contains a word or phrase describing a watermark or similar device.包含一個字詞，描述一個浮水印或是類似圖案。
width
contains a measurement measured along the axis perpendicular to the spine. 沿著與書脊垂直的軸線所量出的測量值

11.3. Elements

addSpan
added span of text加入的文字段
marks the beginning of a longer sequence of text added by an author, scribe, annotator or corrector (see also add).標記由作者、抄寫者、註解者或更正者所加入的較長連續文字之開端 (參照add) 。
am
abbreviation markerNo zh-tw for "abbreviation marker"
contains a sequence of letters or signs present in an abbreviation which are omitted or replaced in the expanded form of the abbreviation.No zh-tw for "contains a sequence of letters or signs present in an abbreviation which are omitted or replaced in the expanded form of the abbreviation."
damage
contains an area of damage to the text witness.包含文件中一塊損毀區域。
damageSpan
damaged span of textNo zh-tw for "damaged span of text"
marks the beginning of a longer sequence of text which is damaged in some way but still legible.No zh-tw for "marks the beginning of a longer sequence of text which is damaged in some way but still legible."
delSpan
deleted span of text刪除的文字段
marks the beginning of a longer sequence of text deleted, marked as deleted, or otherwise signaled as superfluous or spurious by an author, scribe, annotator, or corrector.標記一較長連續性文字之開端，該文字由作者、抄寫者、註解者、或更正者刪除、標上刪除記號、或者標明為多餘或偽造。
ex
editorial expansion縮寫還原
contains a sequence of letters added by an editor or transcriber when expanding an abbreviation.No zh-tw for "contains a sequence of letters added by an editor or transcriber when expanding an abbreviation."
facsimile
contains a representation of some written source in the form of a set of images rather than as transcribed or encoded text.No zh-tw for "contains a representation of some written source in the form of a set of images rather than as transcribed or encoded text."
fw
forme work印版文字
contains a running head (e.g. a header, footer), catchword, or similar material appearing on the current page.包含一個欄外標題 (例如頁眉、頁腳) 、標語、或出現在所標記頁面的類似文字。
 
 @type
classifies the material encoded according to some useful typology.用合適的分類方法將所標記的內容分類。
 
  header
a running title at the top of the page頁面頂端的欄外標題
  footer
a running title at the bottom of the page頁面底端的欄外標題
  pageNum
page numberNo zh-tw for "page number"
a page number or foliation symbol編頁數號或是編張符號
  lineNum
line numberNo zh-tw for "line number"
a line number, either of prose or poetryNo zh-tw for "a line number, either of prose or poetry"
  sig
signatureNo zh-tw for "signature"
a signature or gathering symbol簽名或是聚集符號
  catch
catchwordNo zh-tw for "catchword"
a catch-word標語
handNotes
contains one or more handNote elements documenting the different hands identified within the source texts.包含一系列書寫者元素，列出來源文件中不同的書寫者。
handShift
marks the beginning of a sequence of text written in a new hand, or the beginning of a scribal stint.標記連續文字中轉換書寫者的開始，或是一個抄寫工作的開始。
 
 @new
identifies the new hand.表示新的書寫者。
 @resp
signifies the editor or transcriber responsible for identifying the change of hand.指出負責確認書寫者改變的編者或轉錄者。
restore
indicates restoration of text to an earlier state by cancellation of an editorial or authorial marking or instruction.經由取消編輯或作者所做的記號或指示，復原文件到之前的狀況。
space
indicates the location of a significant space in the copy text.指出來源文件中出現大片空白的位置。
 
 @dim
dimensionNo zh-tw for "dimension"
indicates whether the space is horizontal or vertical.指出該空白是水平的或垂直的。
 
  horizontal
the space is horizontal.空白是水平的。
  vertical
the space is vertical.空白是垂直的。
 @resp
responsible partyNo zh-tw for "responsible party"
indicates the individual responsible for identifying and measuring the space.指出確認及測量空白大小的負責人。
subst
substitutionNo zh-tw for "substitution"
groups one or more deletions with one or more additions when the combination is to be regarded as a single intervention in the text.No zh-tw for "groups one or more deletions with one or more additions when the combination is to be regarded as a single intervention in the text."
supplied
signifies text supplied by the transcriber or editor for any reason, typically because the original cannot be read because of physical damage or loss to the original.指出一段由轉錄者或編者添加的補充文字，添加的原因是該位置的文字無法被辨認，也許是因為來源文件的損壞或內容遺失、或是任何其他原因導致難以辨認。
 
 @reason
indicates why the text has had to be supplied.說明該文件當時必須補充的原因。
surface
defines a written surface in terms of a rectangular coordinate space, optionally grouping one or more graphic representations of that space, and rectangular zones of interest within it.No zh-tw for "defines a written surface in terms of a rectangular coordinate space, optionally grouping one or more graphic representations of that space, and rectangular zones of interest within it."
 
 @start
points to an element which encodes the starting position of the text corresponding to the inscribed part of the surface.No zh-tw for "points to an element which encodes the starting position of the text corresponding to the inscribed part of the surface."
zone
defines a rectangular area contained within a surface element. No zh-tw for "defines a rectangular area contained within a surface element. "

12. [textcrit] Critical Apparatus

12.1. Attribute classes

att.rdgPart
attributes for elements which mark the beginning or ending of a fragmentary manuscript or other witness.提供元素的屬性，這些元素標記岀零散手稿的起始、結尾或其他版本。
 
 @wit
witness or witnessesNo zh-tw for "witness or witnesses"
contains a list of one or more sigla indicating the witnesses which begin or end at this point.一個或多個印記列表，指出於此處開始或結束的版本。
att.textCritical
defines a set of attributes common to all elements representing variant readings in text critical work.定義在文件評論作品中，所有標記變異對應本的元素可用的一套屬性。
 
 @wit
witness or witnessesNo zh-tw for "witness or witnesses"
contains a list of one or more pointers indicating the witnesses which attest to a given reading.包含一個或多個指標的一份列表，連結到已知對應本的版本。
 @type
classifies the reading according to some useful typology.用合宜的分類法將對應本分類。
 
  substantive
the reading offers a substantive variant.對應本提供一個獨立變異。
  orthographic
the reading differs only orthographically, not in substance, from other readings.該對應本僅於拼字法上與其他對應本不同，大致上維持不變。
 @cause
classifies the cause for the variant reading, according to any appropriate typology of possible origins.利用可能來源的任何適當分類法，將變異對應本的產生原因分類。
 
  homeoteleuton
  homeoarchy
  paleographicConfusion
  haplography
  dittography
  falseEmendation
 @varSeq
variant sequenceNo zh-tw for "variant sequence"
provides a number indicating the position of this reading in a sequence, when there is reason to presume a sequence to the variants on any one lemma.當有理由假設任一主題的一系列變異對應本時，則提供一個數字，指出此對應本於連續系列中的位置。
 @resp
responsible partyNo zh-tw for "responsible party"
identifies the editor responsible for asserting a particular reading in the witness.指出負責在版本中插入一特定對應本的編者。
 @hand
signifies the hand responsible for a particular reading in the witness.指出該版本中特定對應本的負責人。

 @resp
responsible partyNo zh-tw for "responsible party"
identifies the editor responsible for asserting a particular reading in the witness.指出負責在版本中插入一特定對應本的編者。
 @hand
signifies the hand responsible for a particular reading in the witness.指出該版本中特定對應本的負責人。

12.3. Elements

app
apparatus entry學術編輯註解項目
contains one entry in a critical apparatus, with an optional lemma and at least one reading.一項學術編輯註解，內含一個不必備主題以及至少一個對應本。
 
 @type
classifies the variation contained in this element according to some convenient typology.利用合適的分類法將此元素所標記的變異分類。
 @from
identifies the beginning of the lemma in the base text, if necessary.必要情況下，指出基礎文件中該主題的開端。
 @to
identifies the endpoint of the lemma in the base text, if necessary.必要情況下，指出基礎文件中該主題的結尾。
 @loc
locationNo zh-tw for "location"
indicates the location of the variation, when the location-referenced method of apparatus markup is used.使用學術編輯註解標記的位置參照辦法時，指出變異的位置。
lacunaEnd
indicates the end of a lacuna in a mostly complete textual witness.指出於大致完整的文字版本中，一個缺文的結束。
lacunaStart
indicates the beginning of a lacuna in the text of a mostly complete textual witness.指出於大致完整的文字版本中，一個缺文的開始。
lem
lemma主題
contains the lemma, or base text, of a textual variation.包含一個原文變異的主題或基礎文件。
listWit
witness listNo zh-tw for "witness list"
lists definitions for all the witnesses referred to by a critical apparatus, optionally grouped hierarchically.No zh-tw for "lists definitions for all the witnesses referred to by a critical apparatus, optionally grouped hierarchically."
rdg
reading對應本
contains a single reading within a textual variation.包含原文變異中的一個對應本。
rdgGrp
reading group對應本群組
within a textual variation, groups two or more readings perceived to have a genetic relationship or other affinity.原文變異中，匯集兩個或多個認為具有根源關係或於其他方面性質類似的對應本。
variantEncoding
declares the method used to encode text-critical variants.宣告在標記不同版本中的變異字體時所使用的方法。
 
 @method
indicates which method is used to encode the apparatus of variants.指明標記變異的學術編輯註解時所使用的方法。
 
  location-referenced
apparatus uses line numbers or other canonical reference scheme referenced in a base text.學術編輯註解使用基礎文件中被參照的行數或其他標準參照架構。
  double-end-point
apparatus indicates the precise locations of the beginning and ending of each lemma relative to a base text.學術編輯註解指出與基礎文件相關的各主題起始與結束的確切位置
  parallel-segmentation
alternate readings of a passage are given in parallel in the text; no notion of a base text is necessary.文件中一個段落的多個替代讀本以平行方式呈現；不需要基礎文件
 @location
indicates whether the apparatus appears within the running text or external to it.指出該學術編輯註解出現在連續文字內部或其外部。
 
  internal
apparatus appears within the running text.學術編輯註解出現在連續文字內部
  external
apparatus appears outside the base text.學術編輯註解出現在基礎文件外部
wit
contains a list of one or more sigla of witnesses attesting a given reading, in a textual variation.原文變異中，表明已知對應本版本的一個或多個印記的列表。
witDetail
witness detail
gives further information about a particular witness, or witnesses, to a particular reading.進一步提供一個特殊對應本的特殊版本資訊。
 
 @target
indicates the identifier for the reading, or readings, to which the witness detail refers.指出版本細節資訊所參照的一個或多個對應本的識別符碼。
 @resp
responsible partyNo zh-tw for "responsible party"
identifies the individual responsible for identifying the witness說明負責辨識版本的人員。
 @wit
witnessesNo zh-tw for "witnesses"
indicates the sigil or sigla for the witnesses to which the detail refers.標明細節資訊所指版本的一個或多個印記。
 @type
describes the type of information given about the witness.版本的資訊種類。
witEnd
fragmented witness end
indicates the end, or suspension, of the text of a fragmentary witness.指明零散版本文字的結尾或中止。
witStart
fragmented witness start
indicates the beginning, or resumption, of the text of a fragmentary witness.指明零散版本文字的開端或重新開始。
witness
contains either a description of a single witness referred to within the critical apparatus, or a list of witnesses which is to be referred to by a single sigil.包含學術編輯註解中所指的單一版本描述，或由一個印記所參照的版本列表。

13. [namesdates] Names and dates

13.1. Attribute classes

att.datable.iso
provides attributes for normalization of elements that contain datable events using the ISO 8601 standard.用於元素規格化的屬性，這些元素包含日期明確的事件，以ISO 8601標準所定義。
 
 @when-iso
supplies the value of a date or time in a standard form.No zh-tw for "supplies the value of a date or time in a standard form."
 @notBefore-iso
specifies the earliest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.以標準格式標明該事件可能發生的最早日期，例如年-月-日。
 @notAfter-iso
specifies the latest possible date for the event in standard form, e.g. yyyy-mm-dd.以標準格式標明該事件可能發生的最晚日期，例如年-月-日。
 @from-iso
indicates the starting point of the period in standard form.以標準格式表示該段時間的起始點。
 @to-iso
indicates the ending point of the period in standard form.以標準格式表示該段時間的結束點。
att.duration.iso
attributes for recording normalized temporal durations.記錄時間長度規格化的屬性
 
 @dur-iso
duration時間長度
indicates the length of this element in time.指出此元素的時間長度。

addName

15. [corpus] Corpus texts

15.1. Elements

activity
contains a brief informal description of what a participant in a language interaction is doing other than speaking, if anything.包含簡短非正式的文字，描述一個對話參與者除了說話以外其他可能的動作。
channel
primary channel主要途徑
describes the medium or channel by which a text is delivered or experienced. For a written text, this might be print, manuscript, e-mail, etc.; for a spoken one, radio, telephone, face-to-face, etc.描述文本傳達的媒介或途徑。書面文本的途徑可能是印製、手稿、寫本、電子郵件等；口說文本則有廣播、電話、面對面交談等。
 
 @mode
specifies the mode of this channel with respect to speech and writing. 說明該途徑為口說或書面模式。
 
  s
spokenNo zh-tw for "spoken"
  w
writtenNo zh-tw for "written"
  sw
spoken to be writtenNo zh-tw for "spoken to be written"
e.g. dictation為寫而說 (例如聽寫) 　
  ws
written to be spokenNo zh-tw for "written to be spoken"
e.g. a script為說而寫 (例如稿子) 　
  m
mixedNo zh-tw for "mixed"
  x
unknown or inapplicableNo zh-tw for "unknown or inapplicable"
constitution
describes the internal composition of a text or text sample, for example as fragmentary, complete, etc.描述文本或文本樣本的內部結構，例如零碎的或完整的結構。
 
 @type
specifies how the text was constituted. 說明文本構成方式。
 
  single
a single complete text 單一完整的文本
  composite
a text made by combining several smaller items, each individually complete 文本由許多小項目所組成，每個個別項目都是完整的
  frags
fragmentsNo zh-tw for "fragments"
a text made by combining several smaller, not necessarily complete, items 文本由許多小項目所組成，每個項目不一定完整
  unknown
composition unknown or unspecified 文本結構未知或未加以說明
derivation
describes the nature and extent of originality of this text.描述文本的特性與原創性的程度。
 
 @type
categorizes the derivation of the text. 將文本來歷分類。
 
  original
text is original 該文本為原創文本
  revision
text is a revision of some other text 該文本為另一文本的修訂版
  translation
text is a translation of some other text 該文本為另一文本的翻譯版
  abridgment
text is an abridged version of some other text 該文本為另一文本的刪節版
  plagiarism
text is plagiarized from some other text 該文本抄襲自另一文本
  traditional
text has no obvious source but is one of a number derived from some common ancestor 該文本無明確來源，但和其他文本有共同的衍生來歷
domain
domain of use應用領域
describes the most important social context in which the text was realized or for which it is intended, for example private vs. public, education, religion, etc.描述該文本最重要的應用領域或是社會用途所在，例如私人與公共、教育、宗教等。
 
 @type
categorizes the domain of use. 將應用領域分類。
 
  art
art and entertainment 藝術和娛樂
  domestic
domestic and private 家庭和私人
  religious
religious and ceremonial 宗教和儀式
  business
business and work place 商業和工作場所
  education
education 教育
  govt
governmentNo zh-tw for "government"
government and law 政府和法律
  public
other forms of public context 其他公共領域
factuality
describes the extent to which the text may be regarded as imaginative or non-imaginative, that is, as describing a fictional or a non-fictional world. 描述該文本內容可能被認定為想像的程度、所描繪的為虛構或真實的世界。
 
 @type
categorizes the factuality of the text. 將文本的真實性分類。
 
  fiction
the text is to be regarded as entirely imaginative 文本為完全虛構
  fact
the text is to be regarded as entirely informative or factual 文本完全根據事實
  mixed
the text contains a mixture of fact and fiction 文本內容部分虛構、部分根據事實
  inapplicable
the fiction/fact distinction is not regarded as helpful or appropriate to this text 該文本不適宜使用虛構／真實的區分方法
interaction
describes the extent, cardinality and nature of any interaction among those producing and experiencing the text, for example in the form of response or interjection, commentary, etc.描述文本創作者與體驗者之間互動關係的規範、基數和特性，例如回應或感嘆、評論等。
 
 @type
specifies the degree of interaction between active and passive participants in the text. 說明文本中主動與被動參與者之間的互動程度。
 
  none
no interaction of any kind, e.g. a monologue 無任何互動，例如獨白
  partial
some degree of interaction, e.g. a monologue with set responses 某種程度上的互動，例如具有背景回應的獨白
  complete
complete interaction, e.g. a face to face conversation 完全性的互動，例如面對面交談
  inapplicable
this parameter is inappropriate or inapplicable in this case 這項特性在此不適當或不適用
 @active
specifies the number of active participants (or addressors) producing parts of the text. 說明創作文本部份內容的主動參與者 (或傳達者) 的人數。
 
  singular
a single addressor 一位傳達者
  plural
many addressors 多位傳達者
  corporate
a corporate addressor 集體傳達者
  unknown
number of addressors unknown or unspecifiable 傳達人數未知或未指明
 @passive
specifies the number of passive participants (or addressees) to whom a text is directed or in whose presence it is created or performed. 說明文本內容的被動參與者 (或接收者) 的人數，被動參與者即為文本產生或呈現的對象。
 
  self
text is addressed to the originator e.g. a diary 文本內容傳遞給原創作者，例如日記
  single
text is addressed to one other person e.g. a personal letter 文本內容傳遞給另一個人，例如私人信件
  many
text is addressed to a countable number of others e.g. a conversation in which all participants are identified 文本內容傳遞給一群人數可計的對象，例如參與者身分皆明確的一場對話
  group
text is addressed to an undefined but fixed number of participants e.g. a lecture 文本內容傳遞給一群身分不明確但人數固定的參與者，例如授課
  world
text is addressed to an undefined and indeterminately large number e.g. a published book 文本內容傳遞給眾多身分不明確、數量亦不固定的參與者，例如出版的書籍
locale
contains a brief informal description of the kind of place concerned, for example: a room, a restaurant, a park bench, etc.包含簡短非正式的文字描述地點的性質，例如房間、餐廳、公園長椅等。
particDesc
participation description參與描述
describes the identifiable speakers, voices, or other participants in a linguistic interaction. 描述在一個語言互動中可辨識的說話者、聲音或其他參與者。
preparedness
describes the extent to which a text may be regarded as prepared or spontaneous. 描述文本可能被視為經過準備或自然呈現的程度。
 
 @type
a keyword characterizing the type of preparedness. 說明準備程度的類型。
 
  none
spontaneous or unprepared 自然呈現或未經準備
  scripted
follows a script 依照稿子
  formulaic
follows a predefined set of conventions 依照一套事先定義的常規
  revised
polished or revised before presentation 文本呈現前事先經過潤飾或修訂
purpose
characterizes a single purpose or communicative function of the text.描述該文本的一項目的或溝通功能
 
 @type
specifies a particular kind of purpose. 說明一項特定類型的目的。
 
  persuade
didactic, advertising, propaganda, etc. 教導、廣告、宣傳等
  express
self expression, confessional, etc. 自我表達、自白等
  inform
convey information, educate, etc. 傳達訊息、教育等
  entertain
amuse, entertain, etc. 消遣、娛樂等
 @degree
specifies the extent to which this purpose predominates.說明該目的所佔的重要性程度。
setting
describes one particular setting in which a language interaction takes place.描述語言互動發生的一個特定背景。
settingDesc
setting description背景描述
describes the setting or settings within which a language interaction takes place, either as a prose description or as a series of setting elements.描述語言互動所發生的一個或多個背景，可用一段散文描述或是一系列的背景元素來表達。
textDesc
text description文本描述
provides a description of a text in terms of its situational parameters.提供文本在情境特徵方面的相關描述。

16. [linking] Linking, segmentation and alignment

16.1. Attribute classes

att.global.linking
defines a set of attributes for hypertext and other linking, which are enabled for all elements when the additional tag set for linking is selected.定義一組用於超文字連結及其他連結的屬性，當連結的附加標籤組被選擇時，這些屬性可用於所有元素。
 
 @corresp
correspondsNo zh-tw for "corresponds"
points to elements that correspond to the current element in some way.連結到的元素在某方面符合現有元素。
 @synch
synchronousNo zh-tw for "synchronous"
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.連結到的元素和現有元素同時出現。
 @sameAs
points to an element that is the same as the current element.連結到的元素和現有元素相同。
 @copyOf
points to an element of which the current element is a copy.現有元素為所連結元素的複製本。
 @next
points to the next element of a virtual aggregate of which the current element is part.連結到現有元素所屬虛擬集合中的下一個元素。
 @prev
previousNo zh-tw for "previous"
points to the previous element of a virtual aggregate of which the current element is part.連結到現有元素所屬虛擬集合中的上一個元素。
 @exclude
points to elements that are in exclusive alternation with the current element.連結到的元素是現有元素的專有替換元素。
 @select
selects one or more alternants; if one alternant is selected, the ambiguity or uncertainty is marked as resolved. If more than one alternant is selected, the degree of ambiguity or uncertainty is marked as reduced by the number of alternants not selected.選擇一個或多個替換；若選擇一個替換，則疑惑或不明確被標記為已解決。若選擇的替換多於一個，則疑惑或不明確的程度因為未選擇的替換而被標記為減低。
att.pointing
defines a set of attributes used by all elements which point to other elements by means of one or more URI references.定義一組與其他元素相連結的所有元素皆使用的屬性，連結是使用ㄧ個或多個統一資源識別符 (URI) 參照。
 
 @type
categorizes the pointer in some respect, using any convenient set of categories.用任何合宜的類別，在某方面將指標分類。
 @evaluate
specifies the intended meaning when the target of a pointer is itself a pointer.若指標的目標本身為指標，則在此說明其用意。
 
  all
if the element pointed to is itself a pointer, then the target of that pointer will be taken, and so on, until an element is found which is not a pointer.若指向的元素本身為指標，則該指標的目標會被移除，依此類推，直到找到一個非指標的元素為止。
  one
if the element pointed to is itself a pointer, then its target (whether a pointer or not) is taken as the target of this pointer.若指向的元素本身為指標，則該指標的目標(無論是否為指標)會作為這項指標的目標。
  none
no further evaluation of targets is carried out beyond that needed to find the element specified in the pointer's target.尋找指標的目標元素時，未對目標進行不必要的延伸評估。
att.pointing.group
defines a set of attributes common to all elements which enclose groups of pointer elements.定義一組屬性，通用於所有包含指標元素群組的元素。
 
 @domains
optionally specifies the identifiers of the elements within which all elements indicated by the contents of this element lie.標明元素的識別符碼 (但非必備) ，此元素內容所指明的元素皆包含於這些元素當中。
 @targFunc
target functionNo zh-tw for "target function"
describes the function of each of the values of the targets attribute of the enclosed link, join, or alt tags.描述每個元素標籤link、join、或alt當中的屬性targets的屬性值功能。

16.2. Model classes

att.global.linking
defines a set of attributes for hypertext and other linking, which are enabled for all elements when the additional tag set for linking is selected.定義一組用於超文字連結及其他連結的屬性，當連結的附加標籤組被選擇時，這些屬性可用於所有元素。
 
 @corresp
correspondsNo zh-tw for "corresponds"
points to elements that correspond to the current element in some way.連結到的元素在某方面符合現有元素。
 @synch
synchronousNo zh-tw for "synchronous"
points to elements that are synchronous with the current element.連結到的元素和現有元素同時出現。
 @sameAs
points to an element that is the same as the current element.連結到的元素和現有元素相同。

 @prev
previousNo zh-tw for "previous"

 @exclude

 @type
categorizes the pointer in some respect, using any convenient set of categories.用任何合宜的類別，在某方面將指標分類。
 @evaluate
specifies the intended meaning when the target of a pointer is itself a pointer.若指標的目標本身為指標，則在此說明其用意。

att.pointing.group
defines a set of attributes common to all elements which enclose groups of pointer elements.定義一組屬性，通用於所有包含指標元素群組的元素。

optionally specifies the identifiers of the elements within which all elements indicated by the contents of this element lie.標明元素的識別符碼 (但非必備) ，此元素內容所指明的元素皆包含於這些元素當中。
 @targFunc
target functionNo zh-tw for "target function"
describes the function of each of the values of the targets attribute of the enclosed link, join, or alt tags.描述每個元素標籤link、join、或alt當中的屬性targets的屬性值功能。

16.3. Elements

ab
anonymous block匿名區塊
contains any arbitrary component-level unit of text, acting as an anonymous container for phrase or inter level elements analogous to, but without the semantic baggage of, a paragraph.包含文件中任何隨機組合性層次的單元，匿名收容類似一個段落、但不包含段落語義的字詞或中間層元素。
 
 @part
specifies whether or not the block is complete. 標明區塊是否完全。
 
  Y
yesNo zh-tw for "yes"
the block is incomplete區塊不完全
  N
noNo zh-tw for "no"
either the block is complete, or no claim is made as to its completeness區塊完全，或完全程度不明
  I
initialNo zh-tw for "initial"
the initial part of an incomplete block不完全區塊的起始部分
  M
medialNo zh-tw for "medial"
a medial part of an incomplete block不完全區塊的中段部分
  F
finalNo zh-tw for "final"
the final part of an incomplete block不完全區塊的末端部分
alt
alternation替換
identifies an alternation or a set of choices among elements or passages.標明一個替換，或是元素或段落之間的一組不同選擇。
 
 @targets
specifies the identifiers of the alternative elements or passages.標明替換元素或段落的識別符碼。
 @mode
states whether the alternations gathered in this collection are exclusive or inclusive.說明在此集合中的替換物件是唯一的或通用的。
 
  excl
exclusiveNo zh-tw for "exclusive"
indicates that the alternation is exclusive, i.e. that at most one of the alternatives occurs.替換物件是唯一的，例如最多只出現一個替換。
  incl
inclusiveNo zh-tw for "inclusive"
indicates that the alternation is not exclusive, i.e. that one or more of the alternatives occur.替換物件不是唯一的，例如出現一個或多個替換。
 @weights
If mode is excl, each weight states the probability that the corresponding alternative occurs. If mode is incl each weight states the probability that the corresponding alternative occurs given that at least one of the other alternatives occurs.若屬性mode的屬性值是excl，則每個weight皆表明相對應替換的可能性。若屬性mode的屬性值是incl，則每個weight皆表明，在至少一個其他替換存在的前提下，相對應替換的可能性
altGrp
alternation group替換群組
groups a collection of alt elements and possibly pointers.匯集一群替換元素和可能指標。
 
 @mode
states whether the alternations gathered in this collection are exclusive or inclusive.說明在此集合中的替換物件是專有的或通用的。
 
  excl
exclusiveNo zh-tw for "exclusive"
indicates that the alternation is exclusive, i.e. that at most one of the alternatives occurs.替換物件是專有的，例如最多只出現一個替換。
  incl
inclusiveNo zh-tw for "inclusive"
indicates that the alternation is not exclusive, i.e. that one or more of the alternatives occur.替換物件不是專有的，例如出現一個或多個替換。
anchor
anchor point錨點
attaches an identifier to a point within a text, whether or not it corresponds with a textual element.在文件中某一位置附上識別符碼，無論該位置是否符合一個文字性元素。
join
identifies a possibly fragmented segment of text, by pointing at the possibly discontiguous elements which compose it.標明文本中可能的不完整分割，指向構成此不完整分割的可能不連接元素。
 
 @targets
specifies the identifiers of the elements or passages to be joined into a virtual element.標明與一個虛擬元素相連結的元素或段落識別符碼。
 @result
specifies the name of an element which this aggregation may be understood to represent.指出一個推斷該元素集合所代表的元素名稱。
 @scope
indicates whether the targets to be joined include the entire element indicated (the entire subtree including its root), or just the children of the target (the branches of the subtree).指出被連結的目標是否包含所指元素的完整部份 (完整樹狀圖包含根節點) ，或僅包含該目標的子元素 (樹狀分支部份) 。
 
  root
the rooted subtrees indicated by the targets attribute are joined, each subtree become a child of the virtual element created by the join由屬性target所指明、具根節點的樹狀圖彼此連結，每個樹狀圖成為該連結所產生之虛擬元素的子元素。
  branches
the children of the subtrees indicated by the targets attribute become the children of the virtual element (i.e. the roots of the subtrees are discarded)由屬性target所指明的樹狀圖的子元素成為虛擬元素的子元素 (例如捨去樹狀圖的根節點) 。
joinGrp
join group連結群組
groups a collection of join elements and possibly pointers.匯集一群連結元素與可能指標。
 
 @result
describes the result of the joins gathered in this collection.描述此集合中匯集的連結結果。
link
defines an association or hypertextual link among elements or passages, of some type not more precisely specifiable by other elements.定義元素或段落之間的關連或超文字連結，其他元素無法將此連結類型作更詳細說明。
 
 @targets
specifies the identifiers of the elements or passages to be linked or associated. 標明被連結元素或段落的識別符碼。
linkGrp
link group
defines a collection of associations or hypertextual links.定義一群關連或超文字連結的集合。
seg
arbitrary segment隨機分割
represents any segmentation of text below the chunk level.包含文件中任何隨機字詞層次的單元 (包括其他分割元素)。
 
 @subtype
provides a sub-categorization of the segment marked.提供所標記分割段落的次級分類。
timeline
timeline時間進程
provides a set of ordered points in time which can be linked to elements of a spoken text to create a temporal alignment of that text.提供一組整齊的時間順序點，可與口說文本的元素相連結，以建立該文本的時間組序。
 
 @origin
designates the origin of the timeline, i.e. the time at which it begins.標出時間進程的開頭，例如開始時間。
 @unit
specifies the unit of time corresponding to the interval value of the timeline or of its constituent points in time.指出符合時間進程屬性interval的屬性值或是符合其接續時間點的時間單位。
 
  d
daysNo zh-tw for "days"
  h
hoursNo zh-tw for "hours"
  min
minutesNo zh-tw for "minutes"
  s
secondsNo zh-tw for "seconds"
  ms
millisecondsNo zh-tw for "milliseconds"
 @interval
specifies the numeric portion of a time interval指明時間區段中的數值部份
when
indicates a point in time either relative to other elements in the same timeline tag, or absolutely.指出一個時間點，相對或絕對於同一時間進程標籤裡的其他元素。
 
 @absolute
supplies an absolute value for the time.提供一個絕對時間值。
 @unit
specifies the unit of time in which the interval value is expressed, if this is not inherited from the parent timeline.若未由父元素timeLine得到時間單位資訊，則在此指明屬性interval所使用的時間單位。
 
  d
daysNo zh-tw for "days"
  h
hoursNo zh-tw for "hours"
  min
minutesNo zh-tw for "minutes"
  s
secondsNo zh-tw for "seconds"
  ms
millisecondsNo zh-tw for "milliseconds"
 @interval
specifies the numeric portion of a time interval指明時間區段中的數值部份
 @since
identifies the reference point for determining the time of the current when element, which is obtained by adding the interval to the time of the reference point.指出一個參照點，用以確定現有元素when的時間，可於參照點的時間內加入區段而取得。

17. [analysis] Simple analytic mechanisms

17.1. Attribute classes

att.global.analytic
provides additional global attributes for associating specific analyses or interpretations with appropriate portions of a text.提供附加的全域屬性，將特定的分析或詮釋和合宜的文字結合。
 
 @ana
analysisNo zh-tw for "analysis"
indicates one or more elements containing interpretations of the element on which the ana attribute appears.指出一個或多個元素，其中包含帶有屬性ana的元素解釋。

17.2. Model classes

att.global.analytic
provides additional global attributes for associating specific analyses or interpretations with appropriate portions of a text.提供附加的全域屬性，將特定的分析或詮釋和合宜的文字結合。
 
 @ana
analysisNo zh-tw for "analysis"
indicates one or more elements containing interpretations of the element on which the ana attribute appears.指出一個或多個元素，其中包含帶有屬性ana的元素解釋。

17.3. Elements

c
character文字符號
represents a character.表示一個文字符號。
cl
clause子句
represents a grammatical clause.表示一個文法上的子句。
interp
interpretation解釋
summarizes a specific interpretative annotation which can be linked to a span of text.標明和某一文字段相連結的特定解釋性註釋。
interpGrp
interpretation group解釋群組
collects together a set of related interpretations which share responsibility or type.匯集一系列具有共同任務或類型的相關解釋。
m
morpheme語素
represents a grammatical morpheme.表示文法上的語素。
 
 @baseForm
identifies the morpheme's base form.指出該語素的基本形式。
phr
phrase片語
represents a grammatical phrase.表示一個文法上的片語。
s
s-unit句子單元
contains a sentence-like division of a text.包含文字中一個句子組成的區段。
span
associates an interpretative annotation directly with a span of text.將詮釋性註釋直接和一段文字段連結。
 
 @from
specifies the beginning of the passage being annotated; if not accompanied by a to attribute, then specifies the entire passage.指出被註解段落的起點；若沒有使用屬性to，則指出全部段落。
 @to
specifies the end of the passage being annotated.指出被註解段落的終點。
spanGrp
span group文字段群組
collects together span tags.匯集文字段標籤。
w
word單字
represents a grammatical (not necessarily orthographic) word.表示文法上 (但未必是拼字法上) 定義的單字。
 
 @lemma
provides a lemma for the word, such as an uninflected dictionary entry form.指出在字典中該字的詞條形式。
 @lemmaRef
provides a pointer to a definition for the root form of this word form.No zh-tw for "provides a pointer to a definition for the root form of this word form."

18. [iso-fs] Feature structures

18.1. Elements

bicond
bi-conditional feature-structure constraint雙條件功能結構限制
defines a biconditional feature-structure constraint; both consequent and antecedent are specified as feature structures or groups of feature structures; the constraint is satisfied if both subsume a given feature structure, or if both do not.定義一個雙條件功能結構限制；結果和前提被指明為功能結構或功能結構群組；若兩者皆包含一個已知功能結構、或兩者皆不包含，則結果符合需求。
binary
binary value二元值
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which can contain either of exactly two possible values.表示功能值細節的值部分資訊，可包含確切兩種可能值中的其中一種。
 
 @value
supplies a binary value.提供一個二元值
cond
conditional feature-structure constraint條件功能結構限制
defines a conditional feature-structure constraint; the consequent and the antecedent are specified as feature structures or feature-structure collections; the constraint is satisfied if both the antecedent and the consequent subsume a given feature structure, or if the antecedent does not.定義一個條件功能結構限制；結果和前提被指明為功能結構或功能結構群組；若前提和結果皆包含一個已知功能結構、或前提不包含，則結果符合需求。
default
default feature value預設功能值
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains a defaulted value.表示功能值細節的值部分資訊，包含一個預設值。
f
feature功能
represents a feature value specification, that is, the association of a name with a value of any of several different types.表示一個功能值細節，即一項名稱與任一種不同類型值之間的關連。
 
 @name
provides a name for the feature.功能名稱
 @fVal
feature valueNo zh-tw for "feature value"
references any element which can be used to represent the value of a feature.參照任何可用來代表功能值的元素。
fDecl
feature declaration功能宣告
declares a single feature, specifying its name, organization, range of allowed values, and optionally its default value.宣告一項功能，指明名稱、機構、有效值範圍、以及依情況提供預設值。
 
 @name
indicates the name of the feature being declared; matches the name attribute of f elements in the text.指出所宣告的功能名稱；並符合文件中元素f的屬性name。
 @optional
indicates whether or not the value of this feature may be present.指出該功能值是否存在。
fDescr
feature description (in FSD)功能描述 (在功能結構宣告中)
describes in prose what is represented by the feature being declared and its values.描述被宣告的功能所代表的意義以及其功能值。
fLib
feature library功能存庫
assembles a library of feature elements.功能元素的集合存庫。
fs
feature structure功能結構
represents a feature structure, that is, a collection of feature-value pairs organized as a structural unit.表示一個功能結構，即組織為一個結構單元的功能-值配對集合。
 
 @type
specifies the type of the feature structure.功能結構的類型。
 @feats
featuresNo zh-tw for "features"
references the feature-value specifications making up this feature structure.參照組成該功能結構的功能值細節。
fsConstraints
feature-structure constraints功能結構限制
specifies constraints on the content of valid feature structures.指出完善功能結構的內容限制。
fsDecl
feature structure declaration功能結構宣告
declares one type of feature structure.宣告一種功能結構類型。
 
 @type
gives a name for the type of feature structure being declared.提供所宣告的功能結構的類型名稱。
 @baseTypes
gives the name of one or more typed feature structures from which this type inherits feature specifications and constraints; if this type includes a feature specification with the same name as that of any of those specified by this attribute, or if more than one specification of the same name is inherited, then the set of possible values is defined by unification. Similarly, the set of constraints applicable is derived by combining those specified explicitly within this element with those implied by the baseTypes attribute. When no baseTypes attribute is specified, no feature specification or constraint is inherited.提供一個或多個已分類的功能結構名稱，此類型從該功能結構中獲得功能細節與限制；若該類型包含的功能細節名稱同於此屬性所標明的任一功能細節，或者該類型獲得一個以上同名的功能細節，則所有可能的屬性值是為統一定義。同樣地，適用限制的衍生，是將此元素中所明確標明的和屬性baseType所標明的結合。若未使用屬性baseType，則沒有獲得任何功能細節或限制。
fsDescr
feature system description (in FSD)功能系統描述 (在功能結構宣告中)
describes in prose what is represented by the type of feature structure declared in the enclosing fsDecl.描述在功能結構宣告中宣告的功能結構類型所代表的意義。
fsdDecl
feature system declaration功能系統宣告
provides a feature system declaration comprising one or more feature structure declarations or feature structure declaration links.明確指出規範某特定功能結構類型的功能系統宣告。
fsdLink
feature structure declaration linkNo zh-tw for "feature structure declaration link"
associates the name of a typed feature structure with a feature structure declaration for it.No zh-tw for "associates the name of a typed feature structure with a feature structure declaration for it."
 
 @type
identifies the type of feature structure to be documented; this will be the value of the type attribute on at least one feature structure.No zh-tw for "identifies the type of feature structure to be documented; this will be the value of the type attribute on at least one feature structure."
 @target
supplies a pointer to a feature structure declaration (fsDecl) element within the current document or elsewhere. No zh-tw for "supplies a pointer to a feature structure declaration (fsDecl) element within the current document or elsewhere. "
fvLib
feature-value library功能值存庫
assembles a library of reusable feature value elements (including complete feature structures).可重複使用的功能值元素的集合存庫 (包含完整功能結構) 。
if
defines a conditional default value for a feature; the condition is specified as a feature structure, and is met if it subsumes the feature structure in the text for which a default value is sought.定義一個功能的條件預設值；該條件被指明為一個功能結構，且若在需要預設值的文本中包含該功能結構時，則表示條件符合。
iff
if and only if
separates the condition from the consequence in a bicond element.區分條件和元素bicond 裡的結果。
numeric
numeric value數值
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains a numeric value or range.表示功能值細節的值部分資訊，包含一個數值或數值範圍。
 
 @value
supplies a lower bound for the numeric value represented, and also (if max is not supplied) its upper bound.提供所表示數值的底限，以及 (若無標明max) 其上限。
 @max
supplies an upper bound for the numeric value represented.提供所表示數值的上限。
 @trunc
specifies whether the value represented should be truncated to give an integer value.標明是否應將該數值四捨五入而取得一個整數。
string
string value字串值
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains a string.表示功能值細節的值部分資訊，包含一個字串。
symbol
symbolic value符號值
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains one of a finite list of symbols.表示功能值細節的值部分資訊，包含限定符號列表中的其中一項。
 
 @value
supplies the symbolic value for the feature, one of a finite list that may be specified in a feature declaration.提供功能的符號值，限定符號列表可在功能宣告中指明。
then
separates the condition from the default in an if, or the antecedent and the consequent in a cond element.區分條件和元素if中的預設值，或是區分元素cond中的前提和結果。
vAlt
value alternation替換值
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains a set of values, only one of which can be valid.表示功能值細節的值部分資訊，包含一組值，僅其中一個得為有效值。
vColl
collection of values值集合
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which contains multiple values organized as a set, bag, or list.表示功能值細節的值部分資訊，包含形成一組、群組或一列表的複合值。
 
 @org
organizationNo zh-tw for "organization"
indicates organization of given value or values as set, bag or list.說明一個或一個以上已知值的組成是一組、群組、或列表。
 
  set
indicates that the given values are organized as a set. 指出已知值是以一組的形式組成。
  bag
indicates that the given values are organized as a bag (multiset). 指出已知值是以群組的形式組成。
  list
indicates that the given values are organized as a list.指出已知值是以列表的形式組成。
vDefault
value default預設值
declares the default value to be supplied when a feature structure does not contain an instance of f for this name; if unconditional, it is specified as one (or, depending on the value of the org attribute of the enclosing fDecl) more fs elements or primitive values; if conditional, it is specified as one or more if elements; if no default is specified, or no condition matches, the value none is assumed.在功能結構不包含元素f以提供名稱的情況下，宣告使用預設值；若無條件限制，預設值會被指明為一個 (或，取決於所包含的元素fDecl中屬性org的屬性值) 多個元素fs或原始值；若有條件限制，則被指明為一個或多個元素 if；若無任何預設值、或無條件符合，則採用屬性值 none。
vLabel
value label值標籤
represents the value part of a feature-value specification which appears at more than one point in a feature structure.表示功能值細節的值部分資訊，這項值部分資訊出現在功能結構中一個以上的位置。
 
 @name
supplies a name for the sharing point.提供該共享值的名稱。
vMerge
merged collection of values合併的值集合
represents a feature value which is the result of merging together the feature values contained by its children, using the organization specified by the org attribute.所表示的功能值是將子元素中的功能值合併的結果，所使用的組成方法在屬性org中標明。
 
 @org
indicates the organization of the resulting merged values as set, bag or list.說明功能值合併的結果是以一組、群組、或列表的方式組成。
 
  set
indicates that the resulting values are organized as a set.指出結果值是以一組的形式組成。
  bag
indicates that the resulting values are organized as a bag (multiset). 指出結果值是以群組的形式組成。
  list
indicates that the resulting values are organized as a list.指出結果值是以列表的形式組成。
vNot
value negation矛盾值
represents a feature value which is the negation of its content.所表示的功能值和其內容互相矛盾。
vRange
value range功能值範圍
defines the range of allowed values for a feature, in the form of an fs, vAlt, or primitive value; for the value of an f to be valid, it must be subsumed by the specified range; if the f contains multiple values (as sanctioned by the org attribute), then each value must be subsumed by the vRange.定義有效功能值的範圍，使用fs、vAlt、或原始值格式；一個有效的功能值必須包含在指定範圍之內；若f包含多個值 (由屬性org所認可)，則每個值皆必須以vRange納入。

19. [nets] Graphs, networks, and trees

19.1. Elements

arc
encodes an arc, the connection from one node to another in a graph.標記一條弧線，即為圖形中節點與節點之間的連線。
 
 @from
gives the identifier of the node which is adjacent from this arc.相鄰自該線邊的節點的識別符碼。
 @to
gives the identifier of the node which is adjacent to this arc.相鄰至該線邊的節點的識別符碼。
eLeaf
leaf or terminal node of an embedding tree嵌入樹狀結構的葉節點。
provides explicitly for a leaf of an embedding tree, which may also be encoded with the eTree element.為嵌入樹狀結構的葉節點所明確提供的元素，也可用元素eTree來標記。
 
 @value
provides the value of an embedding leaf, which is a feature structure or other analytic element.提供一個嵌入葉節點值，該嵌入葉節點為一個功能結構或其他分析元素。
eTree
embedding tree嵌入樹狀結構
provides an alternative to tree element for representing ordered rooted tree structures.提供樹元素的替換，用來表示整齊具有根節點的樹狀結構。
 
 @value
provides the value of an embedding tree, which is a feature structure or other analytic element.提供一個嵌入樹狀結構值，該嵌入樹狀結構為一個功能結構或其他分析元素。
forest
provides for groups of rooted trees.匯集具根節點的樹狀結構群組。
 
 @type
identifies the type of the forest.標明森林的類型。
forestGrp
forest group森林群組
provides for groups of forests.匯集森林群組。
 
 @type
identifies the type of the forest group.標明森林群組的類型。
graph
encodes a graph, which is a collection of nodes, and arcs which connect the nodes.標記一個圖形，內含節點與節點之間的連線。
 
 @type
describes the type of graph.描述圖形類型。
 
  undirected
undirected graph無方向圖形
  directed
directed graph有方向圖形
  transitionNetwork
a directed graph with distinguished initial and final nodes清楚標明起始節點與末端節點的有向圖形
  transducer
a transition network with up to two labels on each arc每條連線上最多兩個標籤的過境網絡
 @order
states the order of the graph, i.e., the number of its nodes.說明圖形次序，例如：節點數目。
 @size
states the size of the graph, i.e., the number of its arcs.說明圖形大小，例如：連線數目。
iNode
intermediate (or internal) node中間 (或內部) 節點
represents an intermediate (or internal) node of a tree.表示一個樹狀結構的中間 (或內部) 節點。
 
 @value
provides the value of an intermediate node, which is a feature structure or other analytic element.提供一個中間節點值，該節點為一個功能結構或其他分析元素。
 @children
provides a list of identifiers of the elements which are the children of the intermediate node.提供中間節點的子節點之元素識別符碼列表。
 @parent
provides the identifier of the element which is the parent of this node.提供中間節點的雙親節點的元素識別符碼。
 @ord
orderedNo zh-tw for "ordered"
indicates whether or not the internal node is ordered.說明內部節點是否整齊排列。
 @follow
provides an identifier of the element which this node follows.提供此節點所尾隨的元素識別符碼。
 @outDegree
gives the out degree of an intermediate node, the number of its children.中間節點的向外分支度，即為其子節點的數量。
leaf
encodes the leaves (terminal nodes) of a tree.標記樹狀結構的葉節點 (終端節點) 。
 
 @value
provides a pointer to a feature structure or other analytic element.提供一個連結到功能結構或其他分析元素的指標。
 @parent
provides the identifier of parent of a leaf.提供葉節點的父節點識別符碼。
 @follow
provides an identifier of an element which this leaf follows.提供此葉節點所尾隨的元素識別符碼。
node
encodes a node, a possibly labeled point in a graph.標記一個節點，一個圖形中可能帶有標籤的點。
 
 @value
provides the value of a node, which is a feature structure or other analytic element.提供一個節點值，該節點為一個功能結構或其他分析元素。
 @type
provides a type for a node.提供節點類型。
 
  initial
initial node in a transition network過境網絡中的起始節點
  final
final node in a transition network過境網絡中的末端節點
 @adjTo
adjacent toNo zh-tw for "adjacent to"
gives the identifiers of the nodes which are adjacent to the current node.相鄰至當前節點的節點的識別符碼。
 @adjFrom
adjacent fromNo zh-tw for "adjacent from"
gives the identifiers of the nodes which are adjacent from the current node.相鄰自當前節點的節點的識別符碼。
 @adj
adjacentNo zh-tw for "adjacent"
gives the identifiers of the nodes which are both adjacent to and adjacent from the current node.相鄰至與相鄰自當前節點的節點的識別符碼。
 @inDegree
gives the in degree of the node, the number of nodes which are adjacent from the given node.節點的向內分支度，即為相鄰自該節點的節點數量。
 @outDegree
gives the out degree of the node, the number of nodes which are adjacent to the given node.節點的向外分支度，即為相鄰至該節點的節點數量。
 @degree
gives the degree of the node, the number of arcs with which the node is incident.節點的分支度，即為節點所附著的線條數。
root
root node根節點
represents the root node of a tree.樹狀結構的根節點。
 
 @value
provides the value of the root, which is a feature structure or other analytic element.提供一個根節點值，該跟節點為一個功能結構或其他分析元素。
 @children
provides a list of identifiers of the elements which are the children of the root node.提供根節點的子節點元素識別符碼列表。
 @ord
orderedNo zh-tw for "ordered"
indicates whether or not the root is ordered.說明根節點是否整齊排列。
 @outDegree
gives the out degree of the root, the number of its children.根節點的向外分支度，即為其子節點的數量。
tree
encodes a tree, which is made up of a root, internal nodes, leaves, and arcs from root to leaves.標記一個樹狀結構，包含根節點、內部節點、葉節點、以及從根到葉的連線。
 
 @arity
gives the maximum number of children of the root and internal nodes of the tree.根節點所擁有的子節點數以及樹狀結構的內部節點數的最大值。
 @ord
orderedNo zh-tw for "ordered"
indicates whether or not the tree is ordered, or if it is partially ordered.說明樹狀結構是否整齊排列，或是部分整齊排列。
 
  true
indicates that all of the branching nodes of the tree are ordered.樹狀結構的所有分支節點皆整齊排列。
  partial
indicates that some of the branching nodes of the tree are ordered and some are unordered.有些分支節點整齊排列，有些則否。
  false
indicates that all of the branching nodes of the tree are unordered.樹狀結構的所有分支節點皆未整齊排列。
 @order
gives the order of the tree, i.e., the number of its nodes.提供樹狀結構的次序，例如節點數目。
triangle
underspecified embedding tree, so called because of its characteristic shape when drawn不完全嵌入樹狀結構，如同畫出的圖形特徵所顯示。
Provides for an underspecified eTree, that is, an eTree with information left out.為不完全之嵌入樹狀結構所提供的元素，即資訊不足的嵌入樹狀結構。
 
 @value
provides the value of a triangle, which is the identifier of a feature structure or other analytic element.提供一個三角樹狀結構值，該三角樹狀結構為一個功能結構或其他分析元素。

20. [certainty] Certainty and uncertainty

20.1. Elements

certainty
indicates the degree of certainty or uncertainty associated with some aspect of the text markup. 指出標記文本某些部分的確定或不確定的程度。
 
 @target
points at the elements whose markup is uncertain.指出不確定標記的元素。
 @locus
indicates the precise location of the uncertainty in the markup: applicability of the element, precise position of the start- or end-tag, value of a specific attribute, etc.指出不確定標記的確切位置：元素的應用性、開始標籤或結束標籤的確切位置、特定屬性的屬性值等。
 
  gi
element nameNo zh-tw for "element name"
uncertain whether the element used actually applies to the passage.不確定所使用的元素是否適用在該段落。
  startLoc
start locationNo zh-tw for "start location"
start-tag may not be correctly located.No zh-tw for "start-tag may not be correctly located."
  endLoc
end locationNo zh-tw for "end location"
end-tag may not be correctly located.No zh-tw for "end-tag may not be correctly located."
  location
both the start-tag and the end-tag may not be correctly located.起始標籤與結束標籤也許都被錯置。
  attrName
attribute nameNo zh-tw for "attribute name"
the value given for the attribute name is uncertain.不確定該屬性名稱所使用的屬性值。
  transcribedContent
the content of the element may not be a correct transcription of the source text.轉錄在元素裡的內容也許和來源文本不相符合。
  suppliedContent
the content of the element may not have been correctly supplied by the reader, e.g. as in the cases of corr and abbrev elements.標記者所提供的元素內容也許有誤，例如在元素corr和元素abbrev出現的情況。
 @assertedValue
provides an alternative value for the aspect of the markup in question—an alternative generic identifier, transcription, or attribute value, or the identifier of an anchor element (to indicate an alternative starting or ending location). If an assertedValue is given, the confidence level specified by degree applies to the alternative markup specified by assertedValue; if none is given, it applies to the markup in the text.提供一個替代屬性值給指定標記部分—一個替代的類目識別符碼、轉錄、或屬性值，或是元素anchor (用來指出一個替代的開始或結束位置) 的識別符碼。若使用屬性assertedValue，則屬性degree中指出的確定程度適用於屬性assertedValue所指明的替代標記；若無使用，則確定程度適用於文本中的標記。
 @given
indicates conditions assumed in the assignment of a degree of confidence.指出在評估確定程度時所設想的情況。
 @degree
indicates the degree of confidence assigned to the aspect of the markup named by the locus attribute.指出屬性locus所指定的標記部分之確定程度。
respons
responsibility責任
identifies the individual(s) responsible for some aspect of the markup of particular element(s).指出標記一或多個特定元素某部分的負責人。
 
 @target
gives the identifier(s) of the element(s) for which some aspect of the responsibility is being assigned.指出標記責任所在元素的識別符碼。
 @locus
indicates the specific aspect of the markup for which responsibility is being assigned.指出標記責任所屬的特定部分。
 
  gi
element nameNo zh-tw for "element name"
responsibility for the claim that the element is of the type indicated by the markup負責聲明元素屬於標記所指示的類型
  location
responsibility for the claim that the element begins and ends where indicated負責聲明元素依照所指示的位置開始與結束
  startLoc
start locationNo zh-tw for "start location"
responsibility for the claim that the element begins where indicatedNo zh-tw for "responsibility for the claim that the element begins where indicated"
  endLoc
end locationNo zh-tw for "end location"
responsibility for the claim that the element ends where indicatedNo zh-tw for "responsibility for the claim that the element ends where indicated"
  attrName
attribute nameNo zh-tw for "attribute name"
responsibility for the claim that the name attribute has the value given in the markup負責聲明名稱屬性擁有標記中提供的屬性值
  transcribedContent
responsibility for the transcription of the element content負責元素內容的轉錄
  suppliedContent
responsibility for the contents supplied by the encoder (corrections, expansions of abbreviations, etc.)負責標記者所提供的內容 (更正、縮寫還原等。)
 @resp
responsible partyNo zh-tw for "responsible party"
identifies the individual or agency responsible for the indicated aspect of the electronic text.指出負責電子文本指定部分的個人或機構。

21. [tagdocs] Documentation of TEI modules

21.1. Attribute classes

att.identified
provides attributes for elements which can be referenced by means of a key attribute.可利用屬性key來參照的元素
 
 @ident
Supplies the identifier by which this element is referenced.提供被參照的元素的識別符號。
 @predeclare
Says whether this object should be predeclared in the tei infrastructure module.說明該元素集是否為全域元素集，並必須在核心中宣告。
 @module
Supplies the name of the module in which this object is to be defined.提供定義該元素的模組名稱。
 @mode
specifies the effect of this declaration on its parent module.標明該宣告在其來源模組中的作用。
 
  add
this declaration is added to the current definitions該宣告添加在現有定義中
  delete
this declaration and all of its children are removed from the current setup該宣告以及所有子宣告從現有的設定中被移除
  change
this declaration changes the declaration of the same name in the current definition該宣告改變在現有定義中名稱相同的宣告。
  replace
this declaration replaces the declaration of the same name in the current definition該宣告代替在現有定義中名稱相同的宣告

  semi

the values specified are sample values only.所標明的屬性值僅為樣本屬性值。

21.4. Macros

macro.schemaPattern
provides a pattern to match elements from the chosen schema language配合所選擇的模型語言中的元素的模式
